jobText: TXT/50709245.txt	§Property/Conveyancing Legal Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property/Conveyancing Legal Executive§§Advertiser: §Allen & Yee Lawyers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§A vacancy has arisen for an experienced Legal Executive in our dynamic boutique law firm. § §We are a small team located just outside of the Christchurch CBD in a modern purpose built building.§ §We are busy and looking for someone who can pick up conveyancing files and work alongside our directors to run them professionally and competently on a day to day basis including dealing with clients.§ §Please send your CV and covering letter to Jane Allen at §jane.allen@allenyeelawyers.co.nz§ by Friday 16 October 2020.§ §All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50688039.txt	§Legal Secretary | Property Team§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary | Property Team§§Advertiser: §McVeagh Fleming§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§McVeagh Fleming is a well-established, medium sized law firm specialising in all areas of practice. The firm has been operating in Auckland for over 100 years and have offices in Auckland CBD, Albany and Manukau. § §Due to an internal promotion, we have an opening at our Albany office for an experienced Secretary.  In this role, you will be providing full-time secretarial and administrative support to two Authors in our Property team. This role is busy and varied and will require someone who is organised & meticulous.  § §Some of the responsibilities include: § § §opening & closing files. § §drafting legal documents & agreement clauses. § §maintaining and organising files. § §reviewing and proofreading documents.§ §scheduling appointments with clients.§ §preparing invoices and statements.§ §preparing conveyancing settlement statements. § §The key skills required for this role include: § § §prior experience in Property (Landonline, eDealings), Estates, Trusts & Wills.   § §excellent written and verbal English language skills.§ §drafting & document preparation.  § §good time management skills.§ §the ability to work efficiently and effectively under pressure.§ §excellent attention to detail.§ §prior experience with iManage & Aderant preferred but not essential.§ §If you are interested in this role, click the apply button on §Seek§ to submit your CV and Cover Letter (please do not email your applications). § §Candice Petersen, HR Advisor. § §www.mcveaghfleming.co.nz§ §Please note that only candidates who have the legal right to work in New Zealand will be considered. §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as a secretary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50684120.txt	§Graduate/ Junior Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate/ Junior Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Housing and Urban Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Graduate/ Junior Solicitor §      §        §About us | Mō mātou§        §We think all Kiwis should have somewhere warm and dry to live, and we want our cities to lead the world in living standards.  Now is your opportunity to be part of building a new Ministry and a brighter future for New Zealand. §        §The Ministry of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) is here to deliver the Government's programme to address homelessness, increase public and private housing supply, make existing homes warmer and healthier.  We want to make housing more affordable for people to rent and buy and lead quality urban development strategies to create thriving communities.  §        §About the role | Mō te tūnga§        §Reporting to the Chief Legal Advisor, you will contribute directly to the successful operations of the legal team. The team is responsible for providing guidance and operational advice in relation to housing legislation and the Ministry's corporate business, contracting, complex property and development transactions, privacy and development of policy and legislation.§        §Ideally you'll have some post-graduation work experience, in a legal or related field. This is a varied role that encompasses operational and public law advice, with the opportunity to work on property transactions and/or the development of legislation. You will be responsible for providing high-quality, timely, accurate and practical legal advice in a dynamic context and in a variety of forms, ranging from opinions to oral advice through to training clients.  You will take the lead on some complex assignments and projects while contributing to the team's overall programme of work.§        §About you | Mōu§        §          §Law graduate with previous work experience§          §Completed the Professional Legal Studies Course and holding or entitled to hold a practising certificate§          §Take a calm and considered approach to others and your work§          §Be a clear and concise communicator, both written and verbal§          §Be a team player and comfortable working with a broad range of stakeholders§          §Awareness of, and sensitivity to, the cultural values of different ethnic groups generally, and Tangata Whenua in particular§          §Interest in the political decision-making process, and the parliamentary legislative process§        §        § This is an ideal opportunity to build on your legal career and make a genuine difference to the lives of all New Zealanders'.§        §Be part of the journey, help us make Aotearoa a better place to live. Apply now.§        §How to Apply |§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono§        §Please click on the §APPLY§ button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. §For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§        §You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§        §Applications closes 20 October  2020.§        § §        § §      §    §    §      §      §    §  §§§About us | Mō mātou§We think all Kiwis should have somewhere warm and dry to live, and we want our cities to lead the world in living standards.  Now is your opportunity to be part of building a new Ministry and a brighter future for New Zealand. §The Ministry of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) is here to deliver the Government's programme to address homelessness, increase public and private housing supply, make existing homes warmer and healthier.  We want to make housing more affordable for people to rent and buy and lead quality urban development strategies to create thriving communities.  §About the role | Mō te tūnga§Reporting to the Chief Legal Advisor, you will contribute directly to the successful operations of the legal team. The team is responsible for providing guidance and operational advice in relation to housing legislation and the Ministry's corporate business, contracting, complex property and development transactions, privacy and development of policy and legislation.§Ideally you'll have some post-graduation work experience, in a legal or related field. This is a varied role that encompasses operational and public law advice, with the opportunity to work on property transactions and/or the development of legislation. You will be responsible for providing high-quality, timely, accurate and practical legal advice in a dynamic context and in a variety of forms, ranging from opinions to oral advice through to training clients.  You will take the lead on some complex assignments and projects while contributing to the team's overall programme of work.§About you | Mōu§§Law graduate with previous work experience§Completed the Professional Legal Studies Course and holding or entitled to hold a practising certificate§Take a calm and considered approach to others and your work§Be a clear and concise communicator, both written and verbal§Be a team player and comfortable working with a broad range of stakeholders§Awareness of, and sensitivity to, the cultural values of different ethnic groups generally, and Tangata Whenua in particular§Interest in the political decision-making process, and the parliamentary legislative process§§ This is an ideal opportunity to build on your legal career and make a genuine difference to the lives of all New Zealanders'.§Be part of the journey, help us make Aotearoa a better place to live. Apply now.§How to Apply |§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono§Please click on the §APPLY§ button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. §For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§§You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§Applications closes 20 October  2020.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50687857.txt	§Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.§      §Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer §      §        §Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer - Supervised Provider§        §Wellington§        § §        §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§        §We are looking for a Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer - Supervised Provider to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts.§        §You will support other lawyers in the office through submissions, legal research and analysis, and observe court appearances to develop your own skills. You will develop into having your own file load and regularly appearing in court as you gain experience.  You will have expert and talented colleagues around who will mentor you and support your development to the next level of your career.  The PDS is well known for its comprehensive professional development programme in criminal litigation and is considered an excellent training ground and full of opportunities for a successful legal career.  §        § §        §Mō te tīma/About our Team§        §You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and a genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment.§        §The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. The ministry provides centralised business services, infrastructure and support to the work of the PDS.§        §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients. §        §Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §        § §        §He pūkenga tou/Skills and§ Experience§        §To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues.§        §You will be developing an ability to build credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community. As an important member of a close-knit team you will enjoy exchanging ideas and brainstorming - and providing support and light relief when required.§        §You will have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people, this is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do.  §        § §        § §Tono mai/How to Apply§        §APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV, cover letter and a copy of your academic record. §        §Applications close on 25 October 2020 and the salary band for this role is§ $51,849 - $67,098 §        §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer - Supervised Provider§§Wellington§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for a Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer - Supervised Provider to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts.§You will support other lawyers in the office through submissions, legal research and analysis, and observe court appearances to develop your own skills. You will develop into having your own file load and regularly appearing in court as you gain experience.  You will have expert and talented colleagues around who will mentor you and support your development to the next level of your career.  The PDS is well known for its comprehensive professional development programme in criminal litigation and is considered an excellent training ground and full of opportunities for a successful legal career.  § §Mō te tīma/About our Team§You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and a genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment.§The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. The ministry provides centralised business services, infrastructure and support to the work of the PDS.§The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients. §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §§He pūkenga tou/Skills and§ Experience§To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues.§You will be developing an ability to build credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community. As an important member of a close-knit team you will enjoy exchanging ideas and brainstorming - and providing support and light relief when required.§You will have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people, this is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do.  § § §Tono mai/How to Apply§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV, cover letter and a copy of your academic record. §Applications close on 25 October 2020 and the salary band for this role is§ $51,849 - $67,098 §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§ § §§§§

The role focuses on supporting all areas of the Ministry’s regional operations and involves advising clients, advocating in the Social Security Appeal Authority and prosecuting in the District Court.§        §Our lawyers must:§        §          §Build great working relationships§          §Provide clear legal advice on complex issues§          §Support team working§        §        §You’ll join an inclusive and fun environment where we will celebrate your achievements and prioritise your development. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35191§ §Put your legal skills and experience to work, helping New Zealanders to be safe, strong and independent!§ §We are looking for an enthusiastic lawyer to join our supportive and cooperative team and provide quality legal services for the Ministry of Social Development.§ §Our team needs a keen, proactive lawyer who has great client relationship skills, is curious and attracted by a role that provides a wide range of opportunities to work in different areas of the law. The role focuses on supporting all areas of the Ministry’s regional operations and involves advising clients, advocating in the Social Security Appeal Authority and prosecuting in the District Court.§ §Our lawyers must:§ § §Build great working relationships§ §Provide clear legal advice on complex issues§ §Support team working§ §You’ll join an inclusive and fun environment where we will celebrate your achievements and prioritise your development. Our team values diversity and we welcome flexible working.§ §If you are interested, then we’d love to hear from you. § §How to apply§ §To apply, click the 'Apply Now' button to upload your CV and cover letter outlining your suitability for this role.  Please ensure you highlight which opportunity and role you are interested in.§ §All applications must be made online. If this is not possible or if you have any queries, please contact us at §jobs@msd.govt.nz§ §Applications close 18 October.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50706105.txt	§Legal Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Administrator§§Advertiser: §Anthony Harper§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§ANTHONY HARPER§A little about us:§Anthony Harper is a top, internationally ranked, award winning law firm. With offices in Auckland and Christchurch we work with some of the largest national and international clients helping them advance their business goals. §About the opportunity:§We are looking for an enthusiastic and proactive full-time Legal Administrator to join our team in our central Christchurch office! This role doesn't necessarily require a legal background (although this would be beneficial), but it would suit someone with strong document management, administration and organisation skills, who is proactive and shows initiative. The role is varied and will require someone who can manage competing priorities and has excellent time management skills. §As a Legal Administrator you will provide administration support to our Authors in the Property team, enabling us as a firm to deliver a high quality experience to our clients. As part of providing this support, you may at times act in a personal assistant capacity to partners, assist with documentation preparation and collation, file management, word processing and providing cover for reception as and when required. §How to stand out:§The ideal candidate will have:§Excellent verbal and written communication skills including strong comprehension and grammar.§Proficiency with technology and software.§The ability to work collaboratively as part of a team.§A proactive attitude and takes initiative in tasks beyond those required.§Excellent organisation, multi-tasking and time management skills.§Adaptable to changing situations and open to new ways of working.§A strong customer focus and a high level of attention to detail.§Proven proficiency in Microsoft Office with strong Word and Outlook skills.§You'll be an integral part of a small team, in a supportive and collaborative environment.  §If you think you have what it takes to be part of our team please send through your CV today by clicking the 'apply now' button below.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

§evaluating interventions§          §fostering Pasifika into the legal profession and legal academia.§        §        §Whilst based within the Law Faculty at Victoria University of Wellington, the jobText: TXT/50665421.txt	§General Practice Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Practice Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Innes Dean Tararua Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§We have a Fantastic Opportunity for You §to join an established and successful law firm in the Manawatu.§We are one of the oldest, continuous law firms in the Manawatu, offering legal services in various areas of law, including commercial, property, trusts and estates, relationship property, employment, rural and elder law.  We are looking for a passionate Solicitor to join our Pahiatua team and be part of our future. We offer a friendly and collaborative environment and promote career advancement and work-life balance. §We are looking for an energetic and experienced generalist lawyer with experience across the following areas of law: Family law (PPPR applications, Division of Relationship Property, etc.), Employment Law, Elder Law issues (EPOA’s, Estate & Succession Planning & Will drafting), Trusts, Conveyancing, and Commercial matters.§The ideal candidate will be someone who:§Has an excellent academic record;§Has at least two years’ post-qualification experience (we would consider applications from Graduates who have been admitted to the Bar, and have an exceptional transcript);§Has thorough procedural knowledge and has handled files as part of a team and individually across many areas;§Will demonstrate a pro-active work ethic, a high professional standard, clear communication, and is looking for a practice of equally motivated, client-focused colleagues;§Is willing to relocate to Palmerston North or surrounds;§Is willing to commute between branch offices to deliver legal services;§Is interested in contributing to our local community;§Is a self-starter with proven initiative, common sense and enthusiasm;§Is able to keep calm under pressure and has a strong work ethic;§Is a team player; and§Is very, very organised, with excellent time management skills.§What’s in it for you?§As a practice we are committed to growing and investing in our teams. You will be given ample opportunity to demonstrate your expertise, develop your skills, and learn from the Directors. A progression program that reflects your achievements will ensure you are given room to grow, and you will be supported in developing your client base and personal reputation as a capable, trusted and reliable Solicitor.§How to apply:§If you fulfill the above requirements, and are looking for a great opportunity in the Manawatu region we would love to hear from you.  Please submit your CV via the email to §sharyn@innesdean.co.nz§.  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. §Our General Manager, Sharyn Royds, will be in contact with you should we be interested in progressing your application.§Applications close 23rd October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§Do you hold a current New Zealand legal practising certificate?§Which of the following legal practice management software do you have experience with?§§§

We also provide a range of other Kaupapa Maori services.§ §This role offers§ § §A team environment with supportive supervision§ §Developing your career path including honing court skills§ §A broad range of client contacts§ §A competitive salary§ §Ideally the position would suit a Lawyer with two plus years experience, but this is not essential. jobText: TXT/50671186.txt	§Junior Criminal Lawyer Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Criminal Lawyer Auckland§§Advertiser: §Bloem & Associates§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§You will be working in a close team of lawyers and a practice manager.  Our office is based at Albany with a significant proportion of our clients appearing at the Auckland District Court and the North Shore District Court.§ §The role would suit a criminal lawyer with some experience who wants exposure to jury trial work.  The role will focus on trial preparation, appearing as second counsel in jury trials, and assisting the other lawyers in the office  This is a great opportunity for a lawyer who wants to progress in their PAL listing.§ §The successful applicant will:§ § §Have a Pal 1 Legal Aid status or be close to achieving this.§ §Have NZ previous experience in criminal law (a minimum of 12 months PQE)§ §Be appearing in Court regularly.§ §Take responsibility for their learning.§ §Deal with the full spectrum of criminal charges.§ §Be able to drive to all Auckland Courts§ §Have great interpersonal skills and understand team dynamics.§ §Work to deadlines, sometimes at short notice.§ §Be willing to be accountable for their work and outcomes achieved.§ §Be willing to learn about all aspects of practice and business management.§ §Please send your CV and cover letter to §office@criminal-lawyer.co.nz§ by 5pm on Friday 16 October 2020.§ §Please provide your academic transcript with your application.§ §Website: www.criminal-lawyer.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

jobText: TXT/50663280.txt	§Legal Executive/Administrator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Executive/Administrator§§Advertiser: §Innes Dean Tararua Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§We have a Fantastic Opportunity for You §to join an established and successful Manawatu law firm.§We are seeking an experienced Legal Executive/Administrator for a full time role within our firm, based in our Pahiatua office.  You will be a positive and friendly person that is well organised and self-motivated. Your existing legal and office skills will be valued and your ongoing development will be encouraged.  While working closely with a Director, you will be part of a friendly, productive, dedicated and hard-working team with a large and varied client base. §This is a busy, full time permanent, position that will require the successful applicant to undertake legal executive work to a high standard and deal directly with our valued clients.  To succeed in this role you must have high personal standards, strong organisational skills and a good work ethic as this is a trusted position.§The role will include Estate and Trust administration, as well as Property, Conveyancing and Commercial/Business work so if you are looking for an interesting, diverse and stimulating position we would love to hear from you.§This position will involve§:§Upholding and displaying the values of the firm at all times;§Adhering to our current document management system;§Assisting with preparation of necessary documents and correspondence for the assigned Director/s;§Assisting in all areas of Property Law;§Assisting with Family Trust creation and administration;§Assisting with collecting client information;§Drafting Wills and Enduring Powers of Attorney;§Assisting with drafting leases and other legal documentation as required;§Completing Landonline transactions including obtaining searches and creating e-dealing transactions;§Managing communications and correspondence ensuring all actions are forwarded to the appropriate individual; §Meeting, developing and managing good relationships with clients; and§Maintaining good relationships within our team.§For this position you will need:§Proven experience as a Legal Executive/Legal Administrator; §Very capable of working on Estates and Trusts autonomously;§Landonline and ADLS experience preferred;§Possess a can-do attitude with a willingness to grow the role;§Attention to detail will be ingrained; §Outstanding client service and the ability to constantly deliver;§Professionalism and integrity;§Strong written and verbal communication skills;§Excellent self-management with the ability to solve problems and achieve deadlines;§Skills to lead and manage others;§The ability to be a constructive and approachable team member;§The ability to build strong and enduring client relationships;§To be able to deal with multiple files efficiently, with excellent attention to detail;§Have excellent time management and prioritisational skills and the ability to delegate;§To have a working knowledge of trust law, estate law, retirement villages law and conveyancing and property law or a willingness to develop knowledge in those areas of law;§To be a motivated self-starter with a positive attitude; and§The ability to be flexible.§How to apply:§If you fulfill the above requirements, we would love to hear from you.  Please submit your CV via the email to §sharyn@innesdean.co.nz§.  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. §Our General Manager, Sharyn Royds, will be in contact with you should we be interested in progressing your application.§  §Applications close 23rd October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Which of the following legal practice management software do you have experience with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50700945.txt	§Solicitor Litigation - Oranga Tamariki (Hawke's Bay)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor Litigation - Oranga Tamariki (Hawke's Bay)§§Advertiser: §Oranga Tamariki§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Family Law§§§§§§Solicitor Litigation - Oranga Tamariki§Permanent, full-time§Hawke's Bay Region§About the role§A legal team supports Oranga Tamariki to achieve the goal of all tamariki being in loving whānau and communities where Oranga Tamariki can be realised. The team is a central part of the business providing strategic advice across all work areas.§We are seeking an experienced Solicitor to join our Legal Services team based in Hawke's Bay. Hawke's Bay offers a relaxed lifestyle with warm and sunny weather, extensive vineyards with internationally recognised local wines, and the unique Art Deco stylings of Napier. The region is home to some of the country's leading secondary schools, and offers an array of gorgeous scenery and vibrant culture, such as the Annual Art Deco Weekend.§You will be involved in providing high quality, solution focused legal advice and advocacy services on the range of operational issues facing Oranga Tamariki. The Solicitor Litigation is responsible for the provision of legal advice and assistance to Oranga Tamariki staff in the Hawke's Bay region, will be accountable for the conduct of litigation in the Family Court and at times in the Youth Court or other Tribunals, and will provide support in the management of legal issues and risk.§About us§Oranga Tamariki - Ministry for Children, is the Ministry that supports children and young people in New Zealand. Oranga Tamariki works to advance the wellbeing and positive long-term outcomes of children and young people.§In everything we do, the wellbeing and best interests of children are paramount. The voices of children and young people underpin the design and operation of our services.§What we offer§We offer a dedicated and supportive team, flexible work options and the opportunity to apply your skills and experience to the wellbeing of tamariki. Permanent employees of Oranga Tamariki can take advantage of discounted services from Westpac, Southern Cross Health, and vision care.§Skills and experience§To be successful you will have the following:§Been admitted as a Barrister and Solicitor in New Zealand and have (or be eligible for) a practising certificate§Practical experience of ideally two-five years providing advice to clients and in conducting litigation before Courts and Tribunals§A good knowledge of family law and ideally in the care or protection area§Solid understanding of the justice system§Outstanding relationship management skills with the ability to promote the legal services team§Full driver's licence is essential as travel may be required as part of this role​​​​​​​§How to apply§Please apply online with your CV and cover letter. If you are an Oranga Tamariki employee already, please apply through your myHR portal.§If you have any questions about role, please contact §Monique.Ciochetto@OT.govt.nz§Applications close on Wednesday, 21 October 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50638758.txt	§Solicitor §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor §§Advertiser: §Ministry of Transport§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Enjoy interesting, varied and challenging work!§Collaborative and supportive team culture§Want to work with an engaged and forward-thinking team?§Do you want to be at an agency at the forefront of New Zealand’s response to the global pandemic? Are you interested in being part of a team which is at the centre of legislative reform affecting the everyday lives of all New Zealanders?  If you are a skilled solicitor looking to join a highly-skilled and close-knit team then we want to hear from you!§The Ministry of Transport is taking on a new direction – it’s not just about roads and rail. Transport affects every area of our society and we need to think in broad terms.  We are interested in great thinking, bold ideas and new approaches.§As the principal transport adviser to the government, the Ministry of Transport provides policy advice and support to Ministers to improve the performance of New Zealand’s transport system and related Crown entities such as the Civil Aviation Authority, Transport Accident Investigation Commission, Maritime New Zealand, and the New Zealand Transport Agency. The Ministry also manages the government’s investment into transport, develops legislation and represents New Zealand’s international interest in maritime and aviation affairs. §The role§In the role you’ll not only be part of the a team creating forward-thinking legislative reform at a system level, you will also work across the Ministry to support the Ministry on ensuring good practice in relation to matters such as privacy and procurement.§As a solicitor at the Ministry you will sit within the Legal Team, which provides strategic, high quality, cost effective and efficient legal advice to the Ministry of Transport and Ministers, concentrating on activities which require Ministry-specific skills, or which are regarded as core activities of the Ministry. §About you§Coming from a public-sector background, you will possess strong legal instincts as well as great initiative. You will have a minimum of 12 months experience and the ability to hold a practising certificate. §Along with your tertiary qualification in Law, you will have strong knowledge and understanding of public law and different legislative frameworks. You will have great attention to detail, strong analytical and communication skills that allow you to know what partnership really means, and strive to be part of the bigger picture.§Whilst not essential, it would be great if you have some government experience, but if not, you’ll be a person who easily picks things up along the way!§What we offer§It’s an exciting time to join the Ministry and the variety of interesting issues we lead, shape, and influence may surprise you. As a small, flexible and responsive ministry, we deliver great results by working collaboratively across the sector.§This is an exciting opportunity to grow your skill set and make a real contribution to New Zealand's transport system, during unique and challenging times - if this sounds like you we’d love to hear from you. §Salary band - $78,103 - $110,264. The successful candidate will be appointed at a salary which reflects individual skills and experience.§To learn more about the role and working at the Ministry of Transport, download our position description and for a confidential discussion about the role, contact Brendan Booth, Chief Legal Adviser on 027 574 4391.§You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for these roles at the Ministry of Transport.§Please submit your application online including a cover letter and CV by Monday 12 October 2020.§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50586752.txt	§Legal Secretary§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary§§Advertiser: §Kayes Fletcher Walker Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Support Services Team Leader/Legal Secretary§ §Kayes Fletcher Walker is a law firm located in Manukau.§ §As the Office of the Manukau Crown Solicitor, we undertake on behalf of the Government the prosecution of serious crime committed in South Auckland.§ §We are looking for an experienced Legal Secretary to join our team of 34 lawyers and 11 support staff.  § §Your key responsibilities will include:§ § §Providing high level secretarial support to our professional staff along with the added responsibility of looking after our small team of office administrators;§ §Managing our support inbox to ensure all work is being completed in a timely manner and to a high standard;§ §Assisting with client billing and reporting;§ §Assisting with the on boarding of new staff members;§ §Co-ordinating our in-house training seminars;§ §Identifying any training needs within the support team and organising appropriate training where necessary; and§ §Other general administrative responsibilities.§ §We are looking for someone who ideally has:§ § §4-6 years' legal administrative experience;§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills;§ §Outstanding time management with the ability to effectively prioritise tasks;§ §Strong problem-solving and decision making capabilities; and§ §High level of competency with the MS Office suite.§ § § §If you are looking for a role where you will be valued for your contribution and want to be part of a fun and collaborative office please email your cover letter and CV to §alana@kfw.co.nz§.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Partners are ambitious and team morale is high. There is a steady workflow across the firm, which is practically full service. Modern CBD offices, top partners and genuine room in the team to accommodate ambition and progression for the right candidate.§The Opportunity§There are opportunities for candidates with experience in commercial, property, private client, employment, family and general litigation. Most solicitors in the firm have an area of focus but are encouraged to stay relatively general and contribute across at least a few areas.§The focus is less on experience and more on getting the right people for the future of the firm. Client facers, self-starters, keen learners are all welcomed. This is a family friendly and community minded firm. It is a social environment with Friday drinks, social events and a range of community level sponsorships.§About You§You will be looking for a supportive environment to continue building your legal career. Ideally you will have plenty of property experience and be someone who is comfortable working in particular on conveyancing matters and be very familiar with land online and webforms. Some exposure to leasing trusts and wills would also be desirable.§ §About You§ §You will need to have four or more years’ experience with one or more law firms in, or predominantly in, property law legal practice, with a focus on conveyancing. Familiarity with the Infinity practice management software would be a big plus.  You'll have good attention to detail, strong communication and client skills and be an organised and efficient operator.   § §Benefits§ §In return you'll:§ § §be well remunerated in terms of a contract rate,§ §work in a collaborative and very friendly team environment,§ §have flexibility as to your start and finish times, and total weekly hours.§ §the potential for the contract to be extended or made permanent§ §Next Steps§ §You can click the link to apply now, or If you would be interested in having a totally confidential no obligation chat about this role or your legal career more generally, then please call Mark on §(09) 300 6876§ quoting reference  A002715§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50558196.txt	§Legal Counsel - Infrastructure Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Counsel - Infrastructure Services§§Advertiser: §Ventia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Legal Counsel - Infrastructure Services §      §        § §        § §        § §        §Opportunity §        §You will be joining a business that is the combination of two major Infrastructure Services organisations who have recently merged. Along with the challenge to your skills and knowledge that is presented by the associated business integration activities, the growth agenda of the new entity will provide even more variety to your already very diverse scope of work. As the only member of the legal team who is based in New Zealand you will be the sole in-house expert on New Zealand specific governance, and you will play a leading role in shaping the way that legal advice and support are delivered to stakeholders within the NZ business.§        §The Role§        §Reporting to a General Counsel in Australia and working closely with the New Zealand country manager, corporate governance and compliance will be high on your list of accountabilities. You will operate as a liaison between the business and specialist external legal advisors, interpreting their recommendations and reporting back to the relevant stakeholder with advice on how to proceed. You should be capable of drafting, reviewing and negotiating contracts and you should also have the ability to review tender documents and provide operational legal support when required. You will collaborate with the People and Culture team in relation to corporate employment or payroll issues that require legal advice and you will build strong working relationships with senior commercial managers, offering support and advice on contractual matters. You will also review and assess complaints and information received in relation to the Code of Conduct.§        §This role will suit an experienced legal generalist with the maturity and strength to work autonomously, strong interpersonal skills to develop working relationships with a variety of stakeholders on both sides of the Tasman and the technical versatility to deal with a wide variety of legal considerations.§        §Desired Skills and Experience§        §          §Appropriate Legal Qualifications§          §Excellent commercial acumen.§          §Previous experience in a large corporate organisation.§          §Excellent communication, negotiation and influencing skills§          §Excellent knowledge of commercial law / construction law within the infrastructure sector§          §Risk assessment and risk management skills.§          §The ability to operate autonomously but also collaborate when necessary within the ANZ Legal team§        §        § §        § §        §We acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures. Embracing diversity and creating inclusion is a key component of our talent strategy. The creation of a diverse, inclusive workforce is central to our ability to unlock potential and enhance our success.§To apply for this role, please click the apply button on this page.§Position Reference Number: 111357§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ § § §Opportunity §You will be joining a business that is the combination of two major Infrastructure Services organisations who have recently merged. Along with the challenge to your skills and knowledge that is presented by the associated business integration activities, the growth agenda of the new entity will provide even more variety to your already very diverse scope of work. As the only member of the legal team who is based in New Zealand you will be the sole in-house expert on New Zealand specific governance, and you will play a leading role in shaping the way that legal advice and support are delivered to stakeholders within the NZ business.§The Role§Reporting to a General Counsel in Australia and working closely with the New Zealand country manager, corporate governance and compliance will be high on your list of accountabilities. You will operate as a liaison between the business and specialist external legal advisors, interpreting their recommendations and reporting back to the relevant stakeholder with advice on how to proceed. You should be capable of drafting, reviewing and negotiating contracts and you should also have the ability to review tender documents and provide operational legal support when required. You will collaborate with the People and Culture team in relation to corporate employment or payroll issues that require legal advice and you will build strong working relationships with senior commercial managers, offering support and advice on contractual matters. You will also review and assess complaints and information received in relation to the Code of Conduct.§This role will suit an experienced legal generalist with the maturity and strength to work autonomously, strong interpersonal skills to develop working relationships with a variety of stakeholders on both sides of the Tasman and the technical versatility to deal with a wide variety of legal considerations.§Desired Skills and Experience§ §Appropriate Legal Qualifications§ §Excellent commercial acumen.§ §Previous experience in a large corporate organisation.§ §Excellent communication, negotiation and influencing skills§ §Excellent knowledge of commercial law / construction law within the infrastructure sector§ §Risk assessment and risk management skills.§ §The ability to operate autonomously but also collaborate when necessary within the ANZ Legal team§ § § §We acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures. jobText: TXT/50545975.txt	§Property Solicitor/Legal Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Solicitor/Legal Executive§§Advertiser: §SRB Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §North Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Saunders Robinson Brown is a prominent Canterbury Law firm that has been providing valued advice and building strong relationships with our clients for the last 20 years.§  §We are looking for a Solicitor with a minimum of two years of property law experience or a Legal Executive with a minimum of three years of property law experience to join our thriving Rangiora office. We work with a broad range of clients including individuals, small and medium sized businesses, property developers and farming clients.  Our Rangiora office currently consists of two partners, one senior associate, one senior solicitor, two solicitors and one legal executive and we need another team member to assist our clients and growth of the team.§  §You will work within the property team which is spread across both the Rangiora and City offices. However, the position is based in Rangiora and you will be primarily responsible for providing support to the Rangiora partners and senior associate. You will be involved with a broad range of property transactions from residential conveyancing, financing arrangements, subdivisions, Council requirements and general property matters.  You will work with existing clients with a view to developing those relationships and delivering an excellent customer experience.§  §Professionalism and strong time management skills are essential for this role. You will have a proven track record of excellence in your field. You will have a good knowledge of residential New Zealand Property Law, Landonline, Companies Office procedures and Webforms. You will also need excellent communication skills with both clients and the team, a high level of administration skills, a quality focus, attention to detail and a genuine and motivated desire to provide excellent client service.§  §In return we provide a supportive environment, and a great opportunity to grow your legal experience. Our culture is one which is inclusive, respectful and encourages teamwork and collaboration.   §  §If you are interested in this position, please send your application and a copy of your academic transcript to §vacancies@srblaw.co.nz§ by Friday 25 September 2020. A full position description is available on our website or upon request.§  §www.srblaw.co.nz§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you hold a current New Zealand legal practising certificate?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50539463.txt	§Document Formatting Specialists§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Document Formatting Specialists§§Advertiser: §Document Direct§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$25 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§DOCUMENT FORMATTING SPECIALISTS§Document Direct is growing very fast, and we are looking to expand our team.  We are undergoing a busy recruitment drive, and invite excellent Document Production/Formatting Specialists to join our existing team.§Our document formatting specialists are self-employed and work from home using their own computer and broadband connection and are required to have a fully operating foot pedal and headset. §As a Document Formatting Specialist you will work as part of a team and will utilise your advanced skills to support fast and accurate creation and formatting of documents, spreadsheets and presentations, adhering to specific firms house styles.§The rate of pay for the work will be discussed upon application. §ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES REQUIRED FOR THE ROLE:§Applicants should be able to create, format and update Word documents, using advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word functions such as:§Word styles (creating, editing and troubleshooting);§Multi-Level Numbered lists & linking to heading styles;§Cross referencing;§Bookmarks; and§Tables of Contents.§Ability to learn and adhere to various client’s house styles, utilising the appropriate templates to ensure efficiency, accuracy and consistency.§A good working knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint to be able to create and edit spreadsheets and presentations. §Previous experience of converting PDF’s to Word/Excel is advantageous.§Be able to troubleshoot and health check document formatting.§Accurately interpret complex fee earner instructions and produce documents within the required timescales, seeking clarification when necessary.§Be able to work under pressure and to tight deadlines.§Proofread and quality check all work to ensure that completed documents are delivered accurately and to an appropriately high standard. §Adhere to Document Direct’s working practices.§EXPERIENCE:§Ideal applicants should have recent experience of working within a Document Production unit in a law firm or similar professional services organisations.§Experience of case management systems.§Be familiar with Outlook.§Personal Attributes:§Applicants should be professional with a flexible approach and work closely as part of the Document Production Team. They should also take pride in their work and be willing to learn. §Document Direct is a 100% remote worker company.  We have systems and processes in place to assist our workers to deliver the best service possible to our clients.  You are required to work from home, independently, and make good use of online resources and knowledge base.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in corporate & commercial law?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§

jobText: TXT/50544402.txt	§Lawyer/HR Professional (Otago)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lawyer/HR Professional (Otago)§§Advertiser: §Human Connections Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lawyer/HR Professional (Otago) §      §        §Lawyer/Human Resources Professional (Flexible hours)§        §Human Connections Group has partnered exclusively with Otago Southland Employers Association (OSEA) for the appointment of a Lawyer/Human Resources professional to join their existing team, based anywhere in the Otago/Southland Region.§        § §        §The Company:§        §The Otago Southland Employers’ Association (OSEA) is a membership-based organisation, to support employers to be sustainable, skilled, through advocacy and leadership in best practice. OSEA provides tailored and specialist support and training around Employment Law, Health and Safety and Professional Development to organisations in Otago, Southland and The Lakes district.  §        §The objective of the organisation is to give members easy access to quality, reliable and accurate support in their daily business, assisting them to make good business decisions, develop and manage their staff and improve their systems and processes ensuring that they are compliant across all areas.§        § §        §The Role:§        §We are open to expressions of interest from suitable candidates who are seeking either full-time or part-time work looking for a contract or permanent opportunity.§        §This role will suit a seasoned lawyer or Human Resources professional with a keen interest in employment relations.§        §You will be responsible for the delivery of all the OSEA legal services including training for clients both in group settings and one on one.§        §This role is to complement the existing legal team at the organisation to support members as more businesses need legal assistance and advice in their daily operations in the current post COVID economy.§        §Daily requirements of the role will include providing advice and direct support to employers where there is an employment dispute, disciplinary, mediation, Authority Investigations, performance management and/or compliance needs for members to remain up to date with current legislation and best practice.§        §A further small percentage of the role involves facilitation of training around legislation and employee management best practice. The position would suit someone from a variety of legal or HR backgrounds with sound practical employment law experience.§        §We are open to considering applicants on a part time or full-time basis located either in Otago or Southland the geographical coverage of the membership base. The ability to travel at short notice is an integral part of the role.§        § §        §The Person:§        §You will have a collaborative approach and extensive experience in dealing with Collective Bargaining, Employment Relations Authority, Employment Law Issues, and confidence delivering seminars and training sessions. You will have at least five years’ experience in law or Human Resources.§        §A self-starter, with a strong and resilient nature, able to manage client relations both face to face and remotely. Someone with exceptional organisational skills, who is thorough in their approach and has extremely good attention to detail. This person will be professional and calm, with a warm and friendly nature and active listening skills. As an emotionally intelligent individual you will support clients through often challenging situations offering a firm hand to hold every step of the way, this approach will come naturally to you.§        §Members range from all walks of life, so this person needs to be able to relate to people from diverse backgrounds and have the ability to ‘speak their language’ making each member that they work with feel they truly are understood and can have complete faith and trust in the process at hand, whatever it may be.§        §To apply please send your resume and covering letter outlining your experience in the above attributes to Emily Richards via email to §jobs@humanconnectionsgroup.com§ or call in confidence on 027 9596847§        §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§      §      §      §    §    §humanconnectionsgroup.com§    §  §§§Lawyer/Human Resources Professional (Flexible hours)§ §Human Connections Group has partnered exclusively with Otago Southland Employers Association (OSEA) for the appointment of a Lawyer/Human Resources professional to join their existing team, based anywhere in the Otago/Southland Region.§ § § §The Company:§ §The Otago Southland Employers’ Association (OSEA) is a membership-based organisation, to support employers to be sustainable, skilled, through advocacy and leadership in best practice. OSEA provides tailored and specialist support and training around Employment Law, Health and Safety and Professional Development to organisations in Otago, Southland and The Lakes district.  § §The objective of the organisation is to give members easy access to quality, reliable and accurate support in their daily business, assisting them to make good business decisions, develop and manage their staff and improve their systems and processes ensuring that they are compliant across all areas.§ § § §The Role:§ §We are open to expressions of interest from suitable candidates who are seeking either full-time or part-time work looking for a contract or permanent opportunity.§ §This role will suit a seasoned lawyer or Human Resources professional with a keen interest in employment relations.§ §You will be responsible for the delivery of all the OSEA legal services including training for clients both in group settings and one on one.§ §This role is to complement the existing legal team at the organisation to support members as more businesses need legal assistance and advice in their daily operations in the current post COVID economy.§ §Daily requirements of the role will include providing advice and direct support to employers where there is an employment dispute, disciplinary, mediation, Authority Investigations, performance management and/or compliance needs for members to remain up to date with current legislation and best practice.§ §A further small percentage of the role involves facilitation of training around legislation and employee management best practice. The position would suit someone from a variety of legal or HR backgrounds with sound practical employment law experience.§ §We are open to considering applicants on a part time or full-time basis located either in Otago or Southland the geographical coverage of the membership base. The ability to travel at short notice is an integral part of the role.§ § § §The Person:§ §You will have a collaborative approach and extensive experience in dealing with Collective Bargaining, Employment Relations Authority, Employment Law Issues, and confidence delivering seminars and training sessions. You will have at least five years’ experience in law or Human Resources.§ §A self-starter, with a strong and resilient nature, able to manage client relations both face to face and remotely. Someone with exceptional organisational skills, who is thorough in their approach and has extremely good attention to detail. This person will be professional and calm, with a warm and friendly nature and active listening skills. As an emotionally intelligent individual you will support clients through often challenging situations offering a firm hand to hold every step of the way, this approach will come naturally to you.§ §Members range from all walks of life, so this person needs to be able to relate to people from diverse backgrounds and have the ability to ‘speak their language’ making each member that they work with feel they truly are understood and can have complete faith and trust in the process at hand, whatever it may be.§ §To apply please send your resume and covering letter outlining your experience in the above attributes to Emily Richards via email to §jobs@humanconnectionsgroup.com§ or call in confidence on 027 9596847§ §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in industrial relations & employment law?§§§

As a diverse and future focused business, WMNZ delivers innovative services and solutions to manage and/or recycle New Zealand's current and future waste in a responsible and sustainable way, and is a trusted industry leader.§        §We have an exciting opportunity for a commercially savvy lawyer to join the WMNZ legal team on a part-time basis of approximately 20 hours per week. Reporting to the Head of Legal, you will deliver sound, timely and commercially focused legal advice across all areas of the business to ensure that legal issues and risks are well managed. The scope of legal work is diverse, high quality and interesting and includes; strategic and commercial agreements, corporate transaction support, litigation and disputes, consumer law, competition law, health and safety, intellectual property, resource management and property law issues. In addition, you will contribute to key strategic projects, keep the business updated on legal and regulatory change, deliver training on critical issues and manage external legal advisors when required.§        §The ideal candidate we seek will have the following:§        §          §Qualified lawyer with NZ practising certificate (or eligibility to hold one)§          §Experience in commercial and corporate law with 'generalist' knowledge in other broader legal areas§          §Some previous in-house or secondment experience preferred but not essential§          §Commercial awareness with the ability to provide pragmatic, solutions-focused advice§          §Strong drafting and analytical skills§          §The ability to relate well at all levels and become a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders§          §Flexibility, adaptability and a positive, team focused attitude§        §        §This is a great opportunity to join a supportive, fun and collaborative legal team and contribute to business success. The role will be based in WMNZ's new state-of-the-art premises in East Tamaki. With a dedicated and passionate workforce of over 1,700 employees, and a clear sustainability strategy in place to safeguard our environment for future generations, this is an ideal time to join a market leading business that is positively resourceful!§        §For a confidential discussion about this opportunity, please contact Jennifer Williams at Williams Legal Recruitment on 027 220 8003 or §jw@williamslegalrecruitment.co.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Market leading, diverse business§ §Part-time role approx. 20 hours per week§ §Diverse and interesting work§ §Auckland based§ §Waste Management NZ Limited ('WMNZ') is the leading resource recovery, recycling and waste and environmental services provider in New Zealand, and plays a critical role in keeping New Zealand beautiful for future generations. Reporting to the Head of Legal, you will deliver sound, timely and commercially focused legal advice across all areas of the business to ensure that legal issues and risks are well managed. The scope of legal work is diverse, high quality and interesting and includes; strategic and commercial agreements, corporate transaction support, litigation and disputes, consumer law, competition law, health and safety, intellectual property, resource management and property law issues. In addition, you will contribute to key strategic projects, keep the business updated on legal and regulatory change, deliver training on critical issues and manage external legal advisors when required.§  §The ideal candidate we seek will have the following:§ § §Qualified lawyer with NZ practising certificate (or eligibility to hold one)§ §Experience in commercial and corporate law with 'generalist' knowledge in other broader legal areas§ §Some previous in-house or secondment experience preferred but not essential§ §Commercial awareness with the ability to provide pragmatic, solutions-focused advice§ §Strong drafting and analytical skills§ §The ability to relate well at all levels and become a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders§ §Flexibility, adaptability and a positive, team focused attitude§ §This is a great opportunity to join a supportive, fun and collaborative legal team and contribute to business success. jobText: TXT/50567378.txt	§Senior Solicitor - Litigation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor - Litigation§§Advertiser: §Tyler Wren§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§This is as broad a Litigation role as you will see available in Central Auckland. Working in a mid-tier firm, reporting to 2 Partners you will enjoy a full variation of work across Litigation and Immigration matters in both the Criminal and Civil Courts. Plenty of time will be spent in Court whether that is in the field of Criminal Prosecution, Civil or Private Litigation matters.§ § §A truly diverse role which requires an autonomous lawyer who relishes attending court as well as a varied and challenging workload. To be able to adapt your experience and skills to this role the firm needs you to have at least 6 years' experience of Litigation including Immigration, Legal Aid and Criminal work.§ § §You will be able to take on a large number of files, manage your clients, draft effective arguments from Day One and require little support from your managers. You will be comfortable delegating to less experienced staff as well as mentor and train.§ § §The firm offers a competitive salary, the chance to develop to Partnership/Special Counsel (whichever route you choose) in time, a realistic understanding of the peaks and troughs of workflows for Litigators - so manage your own time approach, a stable, strong wider team.§ § §If you are interested in talking further about this challenging role then please contact §lgray@tylerwren.co.nz§.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50682501.txt	§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor - Construction Disputes§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor - Construction Disputes§§Advertiser: §MinterEllisonRuddWatts§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Construction Law§§§§§§MinterEllisonRuddWatts has the largest construction specific team in New Zealand and is recognised internationally as a top ranked (Tier 1) construction practice in the Asia Pacific Legal 500 Directory, with six partners and over 20 staff. Our team covers back and front end construction law - this opportunity is in the back end construction disputes team.§This role offers you the opportunity to work on top notch, complex, high-end construction disputes and litigation, covering project disputes, arbitration, defective buildings and Construction Contracts Act matters, acting for an impressive client list. You will get plenty of client contact and will learn a lot, working alongside New Zealand's best.§We are seeking a bright, capable lawyer with around 2-4 years' experience, ideally in construction and/or property disputes, however general disputes and litigation experience would be considered. We are looking for someone with a solutions-focused, positive attitude, strong drive and interest in construction.  §The team is committed, energetic, and highly-capable. Not only do they achieve excellent results, but they also have a lot of fun along the way - this is a true 'team', in every sense of the word. Bring your sense of humour and collegial approach, and you will thrive in this team.§About us§MinterEllisonRuddWatts is a top tier New Zealand law firm with a proud 130 year history. Our vision is to be the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people. While we're known as technically excellent, we're also valued advisers that listen and understand our client's business before delivering the best commercial solution.§We celebrate and invest in our team and are committed to helping all of our staff achieve their best. We understand the power that diversity creates, and our collaborative culture and desire to see our people thrive is what sets us apart. §We're proud to be a New Zealand law firm with a global outlook and reach. We have offices in Auckland and Wellington, and connections to an international network through the MinterEllison Legal Group, a leading firm in the Asia-Pacific.§How to Apply§Please click 'Apply Now' to register your profile with us and apply for this job. For further information please contact Kate Bishop, HR Advisor on§+64 9 353 9815§ or §kate.bishop@minterellison.co.nz§All applications treated in confidence. No applications from agencies please.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Corporate Lawyer  Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50638287.txt	§Corporate Lawyer §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Lawyer §§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§The role§ §Our client has a growing Corporate team and has a position for an intermediate level lawyer in its Wellington team two work with two partners who are specialists in this area. The partners do top quality M&A work, advise on joint venture arrangements, regulatory matters and provide general commercial advice to it's clients (e.g. in the fintech and IT sector) as well as work on infrastructure projects. There will be work with a varied client base including large corporates, public sector institutions, those in the energy, mining, oil and gas sector as well as growing NZ businesses. The firm itself has a structured professional development and training system in place so that you can truly grow your skills. § §Your skills / experience§ §3+ years solid experience in a well-regarded corporate/commercial law team (recent private practice experience is preferred but those with public sector or in-house experience may be of interest also).§Good academics - at least a B average.§Passionate about further developing a career in the corporate/commercial law field and learning from experts. § § §This is a chance to be involved in some of the best corporate and commercial legal work in the country. § § § §If you're a NZ qualified lawyer looking at returning from overseas, positions like this are rare in the Wellington market at present - make an enquiry today to find out if this an opportunity for you. § § § §To apply or for further information, email your CV and academic record by clicking 'APPLY' now or call Anand Ranchhod on 027 2746 186. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50544053.txt	§Commercial Property Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Property Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Commercial Property Lawyer§§If you have been thinking it is time to make a move to a new role - why not consider Cambridge! A great opportunity has arisen for a 2-4 year PQE Commercial Property lawyer to join a fantastic, supportive team.  You will enjoy a wide range of commercial and property work including advising on sales and acquisitions of businesses, sub-divisions, preparing and negotiating contracts and commercial leases.  There is plenty of work in this firm and with excellent mentoring and supervision available from two partners you will quickly develop and expand your commercial expertise.   §The firm has an excellent culture with long-standing staff.  If you seek a rewarding role and want to be a part of a highly successful firm, you need to apply now!  §An excellent salary is on offer together with work/life balance within a great team.  Call Paula Watts 027 2221696 for more details or send your CV to §paula.watts@nicherecruitment.co.nz§ §Established in 1994, Niche has been the premier provider of legal talent to the New Zealand market for over twenty years, gaining an excellent reputation across both the public and private sector. Specialising in recruitment for in-house legal teams, top tier legal firms, medium and small sized practices, and Barristers' chambers, Niche is the most widely recognised brand for employment in the legal field and covers the full spectrum of specialist legal positions from qualified solicitors and partners; in-house solicitors through to general counsel and commercial managers. Further information on Niche can be found on our website §www.nicherecruitment.co.nz§Niche Recruiting Specialists - it's who we are and what we do!§§§§§
