jobText: TXT/50580293.txt	§Commercial Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Solicitor§§Advertiser: §James People Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Salary§§Negotiable based on Experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Overview§My client is a progressive Tauranga law firm, assisting clients throughout the wider Bay of Plenty.§ They provide quality legal advice on all matters from high level business transactions, complex relationship, trust and estate issues, to personal or family disputes.§  § The opportunity has arisen for a Commercial Solicitor to join their team. This is an amazing chance to join a growing and well known business in one of the most beautiful parts of New Zealand.§  § §Company Values§§We ask the right questions§To best serve their clients they are committed to asking the right questions to fully understand the different needs of every situation.§We suggest what's best§Working as a team is huge, it's by collaborating on solutions that my client can ensure their customers get the very best advice and solutions.§We think long term§It's essential that good solutions last the test of time. It's this knowledge that guides my clients work from the beginning.§ § §If these values resonate with you, if it's how you work, you might just be the person we're looking for!§ §Up Front§ While the core need in this case is for a Commercial Solicitor if you are an experienced Litigation Solicitor or Property or General, let us know, there may be an opportunity for the right person.§  § On a day to day basis as a Commercial Solicitor you will be involved with:§ § §Starting a new business§ §Compliance and governance§ §Succession planning§ §Planning, management and governance§ §Securities and financing§ §Mergers and acquisitions§ §Residential conveyancing§ §Commercial conveyancing§ §Commercial leases§ §Farm conveyancing§ §Horticultural leases§ §Subdivisions§ §Resolution of title issues§ § This role works across the spectrum of commercial law in the Bay of Plenty.§ § §You'll need at 2 years PQE or more, but let us know if you think we should consider less. Finding the right person to fit the culture here and create great outcomes for clients is critically important.§ § §But that's not all!§The team here is growing. We want to bring people in who really add to the culture and are AMAZING at working with clients. So it's essential that you are a relationship builder. You need to have:§ § §Great communication §| You create confidence when you speak. You listen and can communicate complex solutions in a simple, accessible way.§ §Positive & constructive attitude §| You keep conversations upbeat and you help the people around you. When you're frustrated you don't let it derail your communication or the team.§ §Proven ability to learn §| You're personally driven to improve. You find ways to continually improve yourself so you can bring even more value to clients and the people around you.§ § §To Apply:§Please send in your CV & Cover Letter. We'll keep you in the loop from there!§PS... if you just want to chat and see if it could be for you off the record, call me (James), I'm happy to chat :)§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§§§

jobText: TXT/50696864.txt	§Senior lawyer – Construction (Transactional/Project Advisory)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior lawyer – Construction (Transactional/Project Advisory)§§Advertiser: §MinterEllisonRuddWatts§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Construction Law§§§§§§MinterEllisonRuddWatts was named the New Zealand Law Firm of the Year by Chambers and Partners again in 2020, and has a top ranked (Tier 1) construction practice. The construction team is also the largest specialised practice in New Zealand, with 6 partners and over 20 legal staff. Our team covers transactional and advisory work (front-end), and dispute and dispute advisory work (back-end), across all sectors in the industry. This opportunity is for a senior role in the front-end team.§The team is at the forefront, advising key industry participants on all aspects of the planning, procurement and tendering, and delivery of major projects and works programs. You will work closely with the partners and an impressive and growing client base including central and local government, listed companies, financial institutions and private business. This role offers you the opportunity to be involved in a lead role in significant transactions being undertaken by the team.§Advising in the private and public sector, you will be expected to lead projects by working directly with the client and its project team and providing expert advice to clients. As the ideal candidate, you will have a background of not less than 5 years' construction experience at a senior level.§The team is committed, energetic, and highly-capable. They work as a team and achieve excellent results. If you are this sort of person, we want to talk to you.§Please don't hesitate to call if you would like further details, or to discuss whether your experience could be the right fit.§About us§MinterEllisonRuddWatts is a top tier New Zealand law firm with a proud 130 year history. Our vision is to be the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people. While we're known as technically excellent, we're also valued advisers that listen and understand our client's business before delivering the best commercial solution.§We celebrate and invest in our team and are committed to helping all of our staff achieve their best. We understand the power that diversity creates, and our collaborative culture and desire to see our people thrive is what sets us apart.§We're proud to be a New Zealand law firm with a global outlook and reach. We have offices in Auckland and Wellington, and connections to an international network through the MinterEllison Legal Group, a leading firm in the Asia-Pacific.§How to Apply§Please click 'Apply Now' to register your profile with us and apply for this job. For further information please contact Kiri Sullivan, Senior HR Advisor on§+64 9 353 9991§ or §kiri.sullivan@minterellison.co.nz§All applications treated in confidence.§§§§

jobTitle: Employment Relations - Senior Legal Advisor Job in Auckland - SEEK
experience: Ideally, you will a minimum of 2+ years
jobText: TXT/50650525.txt	§Employment Relations - Senior Legal Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Relations - Senior Legal Advisor§§Advertiser: §Legal Personnel§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§The Restaurant Association of New Zealand is a Not for Profit Organisation serving the hospitality industry. There are over 2,500 members nationwide. The Association prides itself on being the 'bridge' between good food and good business. The purpose is to help our members' cafes or restaurants be successful and great, and to navigate the challenges presented by Covid-19 by providing essential and practical support. In keeping with the industry it serves, the Association is a vibrant, interesting and fun environment to work in.§   § The role has a strong Employment law focus and includes:§ § §advising on a wide range of Employment Law issues, mainly by phone to members, including disciplinary matters, the Holidays Act, and redundancy, restructuring and performance management;§ §responding to personal grievances and representing employers at mediation;§ §negotiating settlement agreements;§ §dealing with matters in the Employment Relations Authority;§ §advising on liquor licencing, leasing and immigration matters.  § § There is also a library of Employment Law and Health and Safety manuals and resources to maintain and the opportunity to write articles and make submissions regarding changes to relevant legislation.§ § Ideally, you will a minimum of 2+ years PQE or relevant experience as a solicitor or human resources professional working with employment law and related areas. You will naturally be outgoing, flexible and open, and easy to interact with. Being a great communicator, especially on the telephone, you will have the ability to build strong relationships with the people who make up this vibrant organisation.§ § The offices are ideally situated on the city fringe with a carpark and the hours will facilitate a great work life balance, with the opportunity to partially work from home.§   § The organisation is open to where you might be coming from.  It might be that you are:§ § §in private practice and looking for a different direction;§ §looking to leave the city and work closer to home;§ §looking to re-enter the workforce after a period out; or§ §you may be in a similar in-house role but looking for a change.§ §   § Whatever your reason for looking to make a move, you won’t be disappointed in what you find here. This is a diverse, interesting and hands on role covering a range of very current employment issues. You have the opportunity to make a real difference and to help a very vibrant sector positioning for the future.  § § If this role sounds like you and the type of opportunity you are looking for then please click on the button to apply, or contact §ally.ashton@legalpersonnel.co.nz§§§§

Day to day, you'll be involved in providing advice around wealth and succession planning matters, trusts, relationship property and asset structuring affairs. If you're interested in property work, there is the chance to be § §Working within this full service firm, there will be no barriers to your own career advancement within the team. If you're looking for a role that can offer greater client contact and an ability to work with a reasonable level of autonomy, then this could be the position for you. § §To be successful in this role, you will have:§Minimum 2+ years' post qualification legal experience in a well-regarded legal team in private practice;§Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build a rapport with clients of various backgrounds; and§Sound drafting skills and the ability to provide advice in a clear and concise manner.§ §If you're thinking about a move to Tauranga for lifestyle purposes or are in general practice and would like to have a greater focus on the trusts and estates area, get in touch today. § §For further information, contact Anand Ranchhod on 027 274 6186 or email your CV and academic transcript to §aranchhod@cobaltrecruitment.com§ by clicking APPLY now. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Employment Lawyer - 4+ PQE Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50699092.txt	§Employment Lawyer - 4+ PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Lawyer - 4+ PQE§§Advertiser: §LegalVision ILP Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§Why LegalVision?§ §LegalVision is a market disruptor in the commercial legal services industry. Our innovative business model and custom-built technology allow our lawyers to provide a faster, better quality and more cost-effective client experience. LegalVision is a leader in delivering legal services in Australia and has assisted more than 150,000 businesses. We were recently named an Employer of Choice by Australasian Lawyer, Best NewLaw Firm at the Australian Law Awards in 2019 and fastest growing law firm in APAC by the Financial Times in 2018 and 2020.§ §After experiencing great success in the Australian market, we are excited to broaden our horizons and launch in New Zealand in 2021! If you’re excited to be a part of a growing business that offers challenging work, a start up environment and plenty of work life balance, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!§ §The Opportunity§ §We’re excited to offer the opportunity for an experienced New Zealand qualified Lawyer to join our successful Employment practice area. The team advises clients of all sizes, from startups to listed companies, to help employers anticipate, manage and resolve workplace issues. You will be responsible for assisting New Zealand based businesses with their employment law needs, and providing support to the broader Employment team based in Sydney.§ §This position is ideal for an experienced and enthusiastic employment lawyer who has assisted a broad range of clients. You are able to work autonomously, and require minimal supervision. You are diligent, efficient, and genuinely care about providing an amazing client experience. § §How You’ll Assist our Clients§ §Drafting and advising on employment contracts, contractor agreements and workplace policies.§ §Advising on restraints of trade and enforcement of restraints.§ §Advising on termination of employment entitlements and risk of claims.§ §Advising on and resolving employment disputes, including attendance and appearance in court.§ §Supporting our LVConnect subscription clients on their day to day employment law related needs.§ §The Ideal Candidate§ §Experienced: At least 4 years of experience in a reputable legal environment specialising in employment law (demonstrated experience in acting for employers is a must). Additional experience in corporate law, specifically business structuring, capital raising and M&A is highly valued.§ §Qualified: Holder of a current practising certificate in New Zealand; willing to become admitted in New South Wales, Australia.§ §Startup savvy: Interested in the NewLaw movement, startups and innovation; excited to disrupt BigLaw.§ §Commercial: Has business acumen; is practical, pragmatic and cares about growth.§ §Ambitious: Hungry to learn and grow; excited to build a practice and make their mark on the industry.§ §Attentive: Brilliant attention to detail; nothing ever slips through the cracks.§ §Autonomous: Likes help, but doesn’t need too much of it; owns their work and is capable of working independently; loves responsibility and working directly with clients.§ §Adaptable: Grasps new concepts quickly; goes with the flow; improves every day.§ §Efficient: Prioritises effectively; focuses on what matters; delivers on time.§ §The Perks§ §Fully remote working opportunity - work from anywhere in New Zealand or Australia!§ §No billable hours, and no suits!§ §Competitive salary.§ §Fast-paced startup environment with endless growth opportunities.§ §Annual budget to spend on external learning opportunities.§ §How to Apply§ §If this position sounds like your ideal next move, we’d love to hear from you! Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so apply early to avoid missing out.§ §A note to recruiters: we’re all over this role, so there’s no need for you to get in touch. LegalVision does not accept unsolicited CVs or responsibility for any fees related to unsolicited CVs. Thanks!§§§§§

jobTitle: Associate - Property Subdivision & Development Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50584599.txt	§Associate - Property Subdivision & Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate - Property Subdivision & Development§§Advertiser: §McCaw Lewis Lawyers Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§We are a well-known law firm in Hamilton having successfully served our clients for more than 100 years. With a team of 40 ‘good people, great lawyers’, we value excellence in the law and promote manaakitanga and kotahitanga throughout all we do. The McCaw Lewis whānau are a close-knit team and we’ve recently moved into new offices in the CBD, reflective of the modern and innovative firm we have become.  We offer a comprehensive suite of legal services, with a focus on property, commercial, asset planning, dispute resolution, Māori legal and workplace law. § §We are looking for an experienced Property lawyer who is capable of overseeing technical subdivision and development projects.  This is not your normal role - it will suit a superstar who wants to be a real expert. This is an interesting and challenging role with the ability to work both autonomously and within a close and collaborative team on a wide range of property matters.§ §Skills, Experience and Work Scope:§3+ years plus PQE§Subdivisions§RMA issues§Local government§Specialist and expert opinions§ §You will be a team player with an interest in being an outstanding property development lawyer while building a profile.  You will have strong technical and communication skills and think outside the square. § §If you would like the opportunity to be part of a caring, experienced and well-established firm with exciting project work, valued clients and great opportunities, please submit your CV and cover letter.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50681233.txt	§General Practice/Property Senior Associate - Bay of Plenty§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§General Practice/Property Senior Associate - Bay of Plenty§§Advertiser: §Farrow Jamieson Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §General Practice/Property Senior Associate - Bay of Plenty §      §About the firm:§Business is booming in this small Bay of Plenty law firm and the Partners currently have more work than they can handle. In spite of the challenges of recent months the firm is performing very strongly and they are optimistic about future prospects. The firm has a long history of serving their community, with many clients utilising the firm over multiple generations. The small, but tight-knit partnership have worked together for a number of years and have a good mixture of youth and experience. Family is everything in this firm with many (including Partners) having young children.§About the role:§As a result of the strong growth and increasing workload, the firm is looking for a Senior Associate to join the team. Your clients will come to you, as their trusted advisor, with all of their legal issues. You need to gain the confidence of your clients and have the ambition to continue to grow the firm. You might be in a larger firm but you want an opportunity to progress to Partner in the next 2-3 years. Perhaps you grew up in a small town and desire to get back to that way of life. You might currently be a general practitioner or perhaps focusing on property and want a broader practice. jobText: TXT/50649744.txt	§Senior Solicitor - Associate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor - Associate§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$80k - $100k p.a.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment NZ Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§The Opportunity:§If you are looking for a change of pace and feel you are getting stale in your current environment then this could well be the opportunity for you. We are delighted to be working with the Partners of this CBD based Law firm and helping them to continue on their impressive journey and to help meet their ambitious growth plans.§You would be joining a relatively small but highly experienced team that recognises the changing market dynamics of the legal sector and is adopting a more modern client-centric approach. They are looking for someone with the capability and confidence to hit the ground running at a Senior Solicitor level or above. As a firm they are highly progressive in their approach can boast a diverse client portfolio operating on a national basis as well as overseas covering Commercial Property, Property Development and Property Investment as well as General Practice across residential and commercial property for SME's and individual investors.§This role will suit a proven and experienced Solicitor (most likely with 5+years’ experience) who understands the nature of a smaller firm environment in that you will be working a more complete process for your client with a real focus on building and developing long standing relationships. You will be given an interesting and diverse workload from day-one as the Partners look to introduce some of their own established clients to your portfolio from the offset, whilst you also establish new business networks. §In addition they are offering an attractive salary and a working environment that respects you seniority and ability and gives you the freedom to run your desk accordingly whilst giving you ongoing support as needed.§How to Apply:§If you would like to know more about this vacancy, please give me a call for a confidential and no-obligation discussion - www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz/t/peter-clark - Alternatively send through your CV via the APPLY button and I will give you a call to discuss.§ §Peter Clark§Director §Fluid Recruitment§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Experienced Commercial Practitioner Job in Tasman - SEEK
experience: This is an opportunity for an ambitious, hardworking, capable lawyer with no less than five years
jobText: TXT/50573273.txt	§Experienced Commercial Practitioner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Commercial Practitioner§§Advertiser: §C & F Legal Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§Are you looking for an opportunity to join a progressive, client focused, very busy law firm in one of the fastest growing regions in New Zealand, whose operation is based on a team approach where all share in the successes of the firm? … Are you interested in being part of a professional legal team that prides itself on excellence and achieving the result? … Are you interested in joining a law firm that stands out from the crowd, prides itself on providing the highest quality legal services, where there is no ceiling on the level of your financial return, where salaries are competitive with the Auckland market and where you are paid based on the efforts you make and the results you achieve and where there is every opportunity for equity participation? … If you are prepared to put in the hard yards and reap the rewards, then read on for the opportunities that exist in this equal opportunity law firm where respect for one’s colleagues and getting the job done are paramount.  § § § §We have a position available for an experienced commercial practitioner within our firm in Nelson.§ §This is an opportunity for an ambitious, hardworking, capable lawyer with no less than five years post admission experience in commercial and property law in New Zealand.  § §Initially you will be working closely with one of our very experienced commercial lawyers servicing clients throughout New Zealand and in some cases overseas§ §The subject matter of your work will be most varied, interesting and rewarding.§ §The position§ § §We are offering a very competitive remuneration package that will reflect the successful applicant’s ability, experience, commitment and results.§ §The work will be interesting, varied and wide ranging, generated from a significant, loyal and ever expanding client base.§ §You will be working with a team of hard working and competent legal practitioners and support professionals.§ §You will have the utility of up-to-date IT support and databases and will work in very pleasant, modern surroundings, situated in the sunshine capital of New Zealand.§ §Our philosophies of practice include:§ §Providing a pleasant, positive and fun working environment focusing on excellence and client satisfaction where our clients are very much advocates for the service we provide;§ §We want to work with people who enjoy each other and share our values;§ §A culture of caring for each other, our team and our clients;§ §Providing an atmosphere for challenge and job satisfaction with opportunities for progression; and§ §Sharing in our financial successes to ensure that the whole team is properly rewarded and individual’s performance is recognised.§ § § §If you wish to make any enquiries about the position, please do not hesitate to telephone Rick Farr on 021 777 443 or §03 545 8080§ §Applications together with resume and testimonials should be provided to C & F Legal Ltd:§ §C & F Legal Ltd§Solicitors§PO Box 1049§Nelson 7040§ § §diana@cflegal.co.nz§ § § § §§§§

jobTitle: Solicitor / Senior Solicitor (Dunedin-based) Job in Wellington - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50629083.txt	§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor (Dunedin-based)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor / Senior Solicitor (Dunedin-based)§§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§We currently have two exciting opportunities available with our clients based in Dunedin. These are well-established law firms with credible brands in the market that work with a diverse range of private clients and businesses. Workflows are consistent and the firms are in growth mode, so you can be sure to get solid experience while working with well-regarded partners in the industry. Our clients are looking to hire at the Solicitor or Senior Solicitor level but are interested in ​considering more senior candidates as well.§ §Litigation Opportunity§ §General practice law firm with modern offices in a convenient CBD location, approachable partners and a pragmatic approach to their work.§3+ years PQE from a general practice, or specialist law firm, in one or more of these areas: relationship property, family law and employment law. Some criminal law experience would also fit well in this role.§Experience appearing in court and mediation hearings would be highly-regarded.§The role will include a mix of matters relating to complex relationship property matters (drafting Section 21 contracts), family law disputes, employment law matters e.g. advising restraints and dismissals, drafting employment agreements, personal grievances claims and health and safety matters.§This is a varied role at a law firm that values people and promotes career development within the firm. On the cards is partnership for the right candidate.§ §Property & Commercial Opportunity§ §General practice law firm with a strong commercial team that advises individual and business clients across various property and commercial transactions.§2+ years PQE in property and commercial law from a general practice or commercial property firm is needed.§The property side of this role includes involvement with commercial property ​transactions, developments, subdivisions, commercial leasing, financing and property sharing arrangements.§The commercial side will include drafting of various agreements, sale & purchase of businesses, corporate law (ownership structures, shares).§Working with two highly respected partners at a firm with a long-standing heritage, this is the perfect opportunity for you if you have a background in these areas and want to work on more complex transactions to further develop your commercial law skills.§ §If you're looking for that outdoor lifestyle and work/life balance role, this is a good time to make the move. You may be a NZ qualified lawyer looking to return to NZ ​or to relocate to the Dunedin region and seeking an opportunity that will enable you to advance your career in an attractive part of New Zealand.§ § §If you are interested in these roles, please “APPLY” by sending your CV and academic transcript. For more information call Harrison on 027 2745 926. § §Thinking of relocating? Cobalt Recruitment has opportunities all across New Zealand, so if you are looking to move to another region or return from overseas, Cobalt is perfectly positioned to help you with your transition. Get in touch with our any of our legal recruitment specialists.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Generalist Solicitor Job in Hawkes Bay - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50559566.txt	§Generalist Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Generalist Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §    §      §Generalist Solicitor §      §        §We have an exciting opportunity to join a leading generalist firm, known for their exceptional legal services, large, loyal customer base and great culture. This firm is in the beautiful sunny Hawke’s Bay, known for its abundance of award-winning food and wine and breath-taking landscapes!§        §This remarkable modern firm has been through a period of major growth and is looking for the right generalist solicitor to facilitate their ongoing success. You will have access to an abundance of varied work, a large range of clients and be representing a firm you will be proud of.§        §The team is friendly and tight knit, with a positive and highly active culture. You will be working under a Partner who has had immense success from early in her career, who can provide invaluable knowledge and is interested in what work you genuinely enjoy. This firm covers a wide range of areas including company and commercial, property, rural, trust and asset protection, wills and enduring powers of attorney, employment, family and Maori legal issues. You will have opportunities to broaden and strengthen your legal skills while working here.§        § §        §The ideal candidate: §        §          §Has minimum 3 years PQE,§          §Is a motivated self-starter with proven initiative, common sense and enthusiasm,§          §Has good client and file management skills,§          §Is proactive, friendly and willing to provide support to the junior lawyers,§          §Is intelligent and highly organised, with excellent time management skills, and§          §Will be in the Hawkes Bay for the foreseeable future.§        §        §What you will get: §        §          §A competitive salary in the Hawke’s Bay,§          §More control over your work,§          §An enthusiastic, welcoming team who enjoy being there,§          §A large range of clients and interesting, sometimes novel work,§          §An ability to be self- accountable and set your own goals, and§          §Exposure to a wealth of knowledge and skill amongst your colleagues.§        §        §If you are looking to work in a firm where you feel valued and enjoy your day-to-day environment – this is the role for you!§        §If you would like to apply for this role, please apply now, or email your CV, academic transcript and covering letter to Kerry O’Rourke at §kerry.o’rourke@nicherecruitment.co.nz. §        § §      §      §      §    §  §§§We have an exciting opportunity to join a leading generalist firm, known for their exceptional legal services, large, loyal customer base and great culture. This firm is in the beautiful sunny Hawke’s Bay, known for its abundance of award-winning food and wine and breath-taking landscapes!§This remarkable modern firm has been through a period of major growth and is looking for the right generalist solicitor to facilitate their ongoing success. You will have access to an abundance of varied work, a large range of clients and be representing a firm you will be proud of.§The team is friendly and tight knit, with a positive and highly active culture. You will be working under a Partner who has had immense success from early in her career, who can provide invaluable knowledge and is interested in what work you genuinely enjoy. This firm covers a wide range of areas including company and commercial, property, rural, trust and asset protection, wills and enduring powers of attorney, employment, family and Maori legal issues. You will have opportunities to broaden and strengthen your legal skills while working here.§ §The ideal candidate: §§Has minimum 3 years PQE,§Is a motivated self-starter with proven initiative, common sense and enthusiasm,§Has good client and file management skills,§Is proactive, friendly and willing to provide support to the junior lawyers,§Is intelligent and highly organised, with excellent time management skills, and§Will be in the Hawkes Bay for the foreseeable future.§§What you will get: §§A competitive salary in the Hawke’s Bay,§More control over your work,§An enthusiastic, welcoming team who enjoy being there,§A large range of clients and interesting, sometimes novel work,§An ability to be self- accountable and set your own goals, and§Exposure to a wealth of knowledge and skill amongst your colleagues.§§If you are looking to work in a firm where you feel valued and enjoy your day-to-day environment – this is the role for you!§If you would like to apply for this role, please apply now, or email your CV, academic transcript and covering letter to Kerry O’Rourke at §kerry.o’rourke@nicherecruitment.co.nz. § §§§§

jobTitle: Legal Secretary - Property Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50625194.txt	§Legal Secretary - Property§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary - Property§§Advertiser: §Madison Recruitment Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§In this role you are responsible for providing support to your team as required. This will involve providing general administrative and secretarial support and ensuring the efficient operation of the team you are assisting. In this role you need to effectively manage the workload of the team, utilising the appropriate resources.§ §Key Accountabilities: § §Client/Team Relations§Develop and maintain a professional and friendly relationship with clients and Brookfields’ staff. Give clients top priority.§Assist team and Brookfields’ staff members to ensure that a high level of customer service is provided to clients at all times.§General Administration§Answer/screen telephone calls and forward messages to authors in a timely and professional manner. Receive messages for other team members when absent.§Advise receptionist of required response to clients in relation to authors' whereabouts.§Organise appointments with clients and provide support for meetings including arranging venue and refreshments if required.§Ensure timely and accurate completion of billing process.§Secretarial Duties:§Assist authors with document management, letter writing, including Dictaphone and copy typing, preparation for settlements, reporting to clients and other matters as required.§Manage authors' diaries, ensuring appointments and commitments are recorded accurately and maintained. Ensure Author is informed and updated of these commitments.§Handle incoming and outgoing mail and facsimiles as required. Photocopy and file outgoing mail (including enclosures)§Set up and maintain effective filing systems, ensuring files are up-to-date, and in a tidy and chronological order. This includes opening and closing files.§Maintain client files, precedents, and research folders.§In consultation with other secretaries in the team and the Office Manager, ensure that efficient cover of solicitors is always maintained.§Continue to increase legal and market knowledge.§Person Specifications:§ §Work Experience/Knowledge§A solid background in property law – being able to run a conveyancing file from start to finish is imperative.§Experience with banking and finance documentation including loan agreements and securities is desirable.§Landonline, Webforms, KiwiSaver forms and Sales Direct experience.§Ideally Companies Office, PPSR, IPONZ experience.§A basic understanding of Anti-Money Laundering and related client due diligence.§Demonstrated competency in word processing and other programs and operation of office equipment (i.e. facsimile, photocopier, scanner).§Excellent typing speed and accuracy.§Skills & Abilities:§Ability to learn new things and retain information.§A quick learner and enjoy getting to grips with new computer software.§A good communicator.§Ability to delegate work and utilise appropriate resources.§Ability to effectively prioritise and organise workload.§Ability to work effectively under pressure.§Well-developed relationship and customer service skills.§Attention to detail.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50598987.txt	§Property Solicitor (4 years PQE) /Legal Executive (6 years PQE)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Property Solicitor (4 years PQE) /Legal Executive (6 years PQE)§§Advertiser: §SRB Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Saunders Robinson Brown is a prominent Canterbury Law firm that has been providing valued advice and building strong relationships with our clients for the last 20 years.§  §We are looking for a Solicitor with a minimum of four years of property law experience or a Legal Executive with a minimum of six years of property law experience to join our thriving property team. We work with a broad range of clients including individuals, small and medium sized businesses, property developers and farming clients.  Our team currently consists of three partners, one consultant,  three solicitors and two legal executives and we need another team member to assist our clients and growth of the team.§  §You will be a qualified lawyer or legal executive and provide support to the Property team. You will be involved with a broad range of property transactions from residential conveyancing, financing arrangements, subdivisions and general property matters.  You will work with existing clients with a view to developing those relationships and delivering an excellent customer experience.§  §A large part of this role will be supervising juniors and members of the team, providing support and solutions on complex matters.§  §Professionalism and strong time management skills are essential for this role. You will have a proven track record of excellence in your field. You will have a good knowledge of residential New Zealand Property Law, Landonline, Companies Office procedures and Webforms. You will also need excellent communication skills with both clients and the team, a high level of administration skills, a quality focus, attention to detail and a genuine and motivated desire to provide excellent client service.§  §In return we provide a supportive environment, and a great opportunity to grow your legal experience. Our culture is one which is inclusive, respectful and encourages teamwork and collaboration.   §  §If you are interested in this position, please send your CV and academic transcript to §vacancies@srblaw.co.nz§ by Monday 2 November 2020. A full position description is available on our website.§  §www.srblaw.co.nz§  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Experienced Litigation Lawyer Job in Tasman - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50573284.txt	§Experienced Litigation Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Litigation Lawyer§§Advertiser: §C & F Legal Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§Are you looking for an opportunity to join a progressive, client focused, very busy law firm in one of the fastest growing regions in New Zealand, whose operation is based on a team approach where all share in the successes of the firm? … Are you interested in being part of a professional legal team that prides itself on excellence and achieving the result? … Are you interested in joining a law firm that stands out from the crowd, prides itself on providing the highest quality legal services, where there is no ceiling on the level of your financial return, where salaries are competitive with the Auckland market and where you are paid based on the efforts you make and the results you achieve and where there is every opportunity for equity participation? … If you are prepared to put in the hard yards and reap the rewards, then read on for the opportunities that exist in this equal opportunity law firm where respect for one’s colleagues and getting the job done are paramount.  § §We have a position available for an experienced litigation practitioner within our firm in Nelson.§ §This is an opportunity for an ambitious, hardworking, capable lawyer with no less than five years post admission experience in civil litigation law in New Zealand.  § § § §What do you get?§ §1.  A most competitive remuneration packages that will reflect the successful applicant’s ability, experience, commitment and results;§ §2. To work with a team of hard working and competent legal practitioners and support professionals;§ §3.  To work in a firm that is committed to staying abreast with IT and other enhancements to ensure the most efficient and effective service to its clients;§ §4.  A pleasant, positive and fun working environment focusing on excellence and client satisfaction where our clients are very much advocates for the service we provide;§ §5.  To work with people who enjoy each other and share our values;§ §6.  A culture of caring for each other, our team and our clients;§ §7.  Challenge and job satisfaction with real opportunities for progression; and§ §8.  To share in our financial successes to ensure that the whole team is properly rewarded and an individual’s performance is recognised.§ § § §If you have any questions, or would like to discuss the position, please do not hesitate to contact Rick Farr at our offices.§§§§

Associate with General Law and Relationship Property experience for progressive role.§ § §Your new company§ Hays Recruitment has partnered exclusively with Pitt & Moore in the recruitment of an Associate to Senior Associate for their Richmond branch.§ § Your new company is a Nelson/ Tasman based law firm established in 1864, with expertise across the full range of legal services from business and commercial contracts to personal legal matters.§ § Their core values include a commitment to being accessible, efficient and responsive; to find real solutions; to communicate clearly; and to conduct themselves with honest and integrity. Pitt & Moore is passionate about their people and the clients they service, locally, nationally and around the world.§ § §Your new role§ As an Associate / Senior Associate, you will be managing the Richmond office and provide support to a team of experienced legal professionals and support staff.§ § This role will be well suited for an individual who is looking to progress into a role that provides responsibility and the opportunity to work independently, manage a client base, supervise a team and also take lead in the management of a branch.§ § As your client base will be a mixture of local clients, the ideal Candidate would have varied experience and can offer knowledge of general practice, covering a strong understanding of property law, relationship property, wills, trust and estates.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§        §          §We are seeking to bring on board a Candidate who proven experience in a similar role;§          §The ideal Candidate is someone who presents professionally and is looking to progress in their career;§          §You are an individual who feels comfortable representing yourself and your firm to the community for the purposes of growing your client portfolio;§          §Culture is very important to our Client and therefore the ideal Candidate will be someone who similarly values the importance of making a positive contribution to their team, wider firm and clients;§          §You are someone who has a strong work ethic and is a confident and professional communicator.§        §        § §What you'll get in return§ Pitt & Moore is a firm known for their excellent service delivery, positive culture and strong leadership team.§ § They have a modern outlook on law whilst still respecting tradition.§ § This firm offers low staff turnover, definite progression opportunities and professional development. It is not every day that an opportunity comes up where you can come in, manage a team, manage a branch, use your brand and knowledge to grow your presence and that of the firm in the community, whilst still enjoying the support from passionate and knowledgeable partners.§ § Pitt & Moore has a very modern approach when it comes to their working arrangements and is therefore ideal for Candidates who are looking for flexibility and a health family/ work balance.§ § Despite the challenges that COVID has brought business across the country, Pitt & Moore continue to experience and increase in client demand and are excited about growing their experience pool.§ § § § §What you need to do now§ If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.§ If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.§ § If you are interested in discussing this opportunity further, please contact Bianca Herbst on §03 669 5503§ or email: §bianca.herbst@hays.net.nz§ OR Josie Reid on §036695718§ or §josie.reid@hays.net.nz§      §      §      §Reference Number: 2429144 §    §    §      §To apply please click§ the 'Apply' button below. § hays.net.nz§    §  §§§Seeking Associate / Snr. jobTitle: Solicitor | Dispute Resolution | Intermediate - Senior Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50572639.txt	§Solicitor | Dispute Resolution | Intermediate - Senior§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor | Dispute Resolution | Intermediate - Senior§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$60k - $100k p.a.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§Above market salary negotiable + carpark + other benefits§Social team environment; Friday drinks, progressive partners§Rare career opportunity to climb the tree and get some proper exposure§The Firm§My client is a household name in the Christchurch legal practice market. Recent change has opened up opportunities in the intermediate to senior bracket for an ambitious litigator to step up into pathway role rarely seen in town.§A well-versed partner and up and coming senior associate drive the team, which is fairly well balanced with the exception of an additional solicitor who may have had a good grounding in dispute resolution, but is wanting an opportunity to get more involved. §You can be a part of social sports teams, firm quiz nights and dinners, and a range of charitable initiatives that help to build firm togetherness. Turnover is very low once people are established at the firm for that reason. Not the type of firm to run its solicitors into the ground with huge hours, which is a hallmark policy of management.§The Role§We want to see someone with some enthusiasm and energy. A drive to learn more, get more time and court and in mediation, and take the chance to lead files more independently. You will be well supported and a individual development plan will be in place from day one and regularly reviewed to make sure you are hitting your own personal goals with the firm.§Skills and Experience§Several skillsets could be adapted to this team so if you have general disputes experience it would be worth making an inquiry. Specifically experience in commercial/civil cases, relationship property, insurance, employment, construction, property, contractual, insolvency, estates or similar would all be useful as the workload is diverse.§A decent amount of time on your feet and an ability to display previous caseload will be ideal, and likely to be sitting in that 2-5year PQE range.§Benefits§Above market salary negotiable + carpark + other benefits§Social team environment; Friday drinks, progressive partners§Rare career opportunity to climb the tree and get some proper exposure§How to Apply§Please use the APPLY button to submit your CV directly to my inbox, otherwise give me a call if you are slightly tentative and after some more information. All discussions are confidential and non-obligatory.§Eden Brown§Manager - Legal - Fluid Recruitment§021 044 3607§Fluid Legal is a specialist division of Fluid Recruitment Ltd. We recruit nationwide, solely in the legal industry. If you are considering a change, or want to chat confidentially about your options, please get in touch.§ §www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50550174.txt	§Practice Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Practice Manager§§Advertiser: §Niche Consulting Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Practice Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §    §      §Practice Manager §      §        §We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Practice Manager to join the Takeovers Panel.§        §The Panel is an independent Crown entity which regulates New Zealand's takeovers market. Their key objective is to strengthen investors’ confidence in the New Zealand capital markets by enforcing the Takeovers Code. The Panel’s work is fast-paced and interesting, with significant impact on transactions involving widely held New Zealand companies.§        §The team, comprising mostly of lawyers, is small, collegial and tight knit. The culture is welcoming, supportive and family friendly. The high performing team is supported by caring leadership, flexibility and genuine work-life balance. You will be a highly valued team member and will be rewarded with a competitive salary package. Your ongoing professional development and growth will be supported.§        §You will lead the administrative and strategic support function to ensure the smooth operation of the Panel. This role advises and supports the Chief Executive in ensuring the effective, efficient and high-quality delivery of the Panel’s regulatory activities and operations. You will be involved with continuous process improvements and will need to be able to assess the effectiveness of current processes and understand the implications of changes made.§        § §        §The role will include the following responsibilities: §        §          §Manage the Panel executive’s day to day operations, from organising board meetings to managing suppliers§          §Process improvement (including assisting with the improvement of IT processes)§          §Manage the document management system, including developing templates and formatting reports§          §Project planning, management and execution§          §Manage the website and social media content§          §Stakeholder engagement and organising events§          §Manage the premises and health and safety duties§          §Provide support to the Chief Executive as required, including preparation of documents for board meetings§        §        §The ideal candidate will have: §        §          §Initiative, and an innovative approach to problem-solving§          §Integrity, resilience and adaptability§          §Proven ability and confidence to build strong relationships§          §Proven experience in a similar role, preferably in a law firm (but not necessary)§          §Excellent time management and organisational skills§          §Meticulous attention to detail§          §High level computer literacy§          §Website management and/or social media experience§        §        §If you would like to apply for this role, please email your CV and covering letter to Kerry O’Rourke at §kerry.o’rourke@nicherecruitment.co.nz by 5.00pm on Thursday September 24th. §      §      §      §    §  §§§We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Practice Manager to join the Takeovers Panel.§The Panel is an independent Crown entity which regulates New Zealand's takeovers market. Their key objective is to strengthen investors’ confidence in the New Zealand capital markets by enforcing the Takeovers Code. The Panel’s work is fast-paced and interesting, with significant impact on transactions involving widely held New Zealand companies.§The team, comprising mostly of lawyers, is small, collegial and tight knit. The culture is welcoming, supportive and family friendly. The high performing team is supported by caring leadership, flexibility and genuine work-life balance. You will be a highly valued team member and will be rewarded with a competitive salary package. Your ongoing professional development and growth will be supported.§You will lead the administrative and strategic support function to ensure the smooth operation of the Panel. This role advises and supports the Chief Executive in ensuring the effective, efficient and high-quality delivery of the Panel’s regulatory activities and operations. You will be involved with continuous process improvements and will need to be able to assess the effectiveness of current processes and understand the implications of changes made.§ §§The role will include the following responsibilities: §§Manage the Panel executive’s day to day operations, from organising board meetings to managing suppliers§Process improvement (including assisting with the improvement of IT processes)§Manage the document management system, including developing templates and formatting reports§Project planning, management and execution§Manage the website and social media content§Stakeholder engagement and organising events§Manage the premises and health and safety duties§Provide support to the Chief Executive as required, including preparation of documents for board meetings§§The ideal candidate will have: §§Initiative, and an innovative approach to problem-solving§Integrity, resilience and adaptability§Proven ability and confidence to build strong relationships§Proven experience in a similar role, preferably in a law firm (but not necessary)§Excellent time management and organisational skills§Meticulous attention to detail§High level computer literacy§Website management and/or social media experience§§If you would like to apply for this role, please email your CV and covering letter to Kerry O’Rourke at §kerry.o’rourke@nicherecruitment.co.nz by 5.00pm on Thursday September 24th. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You may be currently working for a New Zealand firm and seeking change or perhaps you have decided to return home from overseas and looking at your options.  Our client is also open to New Zealand or Both partners spent several years at leading overseas firms, bringing an international perspective to their clients.§ §You’ll be part of a team that is sought after by institutions and individuals for their sharp insight, pragmatic style and their wealth of experience. To be successful in this role, you will need at least 5 years’ relevant experience gained in a reputable team.§ § §For a confidential discussion, please contact Christina Kruger on 027 293 7210 or email §christina@mcleodduminy.co.nz§.§ §McLeod Duminy Careers is a specialist legal recruitment firm and so we understand that being a lawyer is a career and not just a job. We believe in the power of listening so that we can work with you on reaching your short, medium and long-term career goals.§ §For a full list of our vacancies, please see our website: www.mcleodduminy.co.nz§§§§

jobTitle: Legal Hub Secretary, Commercial Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50556206.txt	§Legal Hub Secretary, Commercial§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Hub Secretary, Commercial§§Advertiser: §Morrison Kent§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Leading mid-tier law firm Morrison Kent is growing its Commercial Secretarial Hub and is searching for a legal secretary who can be relied upon to deliver high quality work to a variety of lawyers across the business.  The applicant will have a professional services background and be looking for their next career challenge. §  §Reporting to the Hub Manager and Office Manager, you will be exposed to the full range of administrative and secretarial functions within these busy and varied practices to include: § § §Typing and processing of documentation;§ §Monthly billing;§ §File management;§ §Diary management;§ §Client management; § §Presentations; § §General administration requirements; and§ §In addition, the legal administrators will regularly contribute ideas and initiatives to continue to improve the efficiencies of their Hubs.   § §Essential to the role is your ability to turn work around quickly and accurately.  You must have attention to detail, excellent comprehension and grammar. Knowledge and experience of Microsoft Office is highly desirable and familiarity with legal forms is an advantage.  The Hub is busy and requires team players with high initiative who can work autonomously and efficiently and will do whatever is required to get the job done.   §  §The opportunity exists to prove yourself as a highly competent and safe pair of hands that can be relied upon to deliver excellent work and build your reputation for being a highly sought-after legal administrator.  For those who are keen to build their career in administration, there is certainly scope to grow, master new skills and be challenged within the role.§  §Morrison Kent offers a vibrant and supportive culture with a generous spirit that regularly gives back to their community. §  §To apply, please send a cover letter and your CV to Catherine at §catherine@morrisonkent.com§  §Applications close on Monday, 5 October 2020 unless position is filled prior.§§§§

jobTitle: Intermediate/Senior Property Solicitor Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50587783.txt	§Intermediate/Senior Property Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate/Senior Property Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§About the Company§Our client is a well-known law firm with a good history in Hamilton. They offer a wide variety of legal services to their clientele and pride themselves on the quality of their service and relationships they build. These services include areas of practice such as commercial, property, dispute resolution, environmental/natural resources, and employment law.§The Role & The Candidate§This role will be part of the firm's property team and our client is looking for a lawyer with experiences in a range of property matters with a focus on Resource Management and Property Development, a lawyer who is interested in being part of major transactions and projects. This role will suit a good quality solicitor who is looking for a variety of work and is comfortable being to subject matter leader and a real expert amongst a team. This is an interesting and challenging role with the ability to work autonomously but within an experienced, highly skilled and collaborative team, and as mentioned previously on issues under the Resource Management Act, Local Government Act, Unit Titles Act and Land Transfer Act.§The Successful candidate will likely be/have:§5+ years plus PQE§Subdivisions experience§RMA issues experience §Local government experience§Specialist and expert opinions§Corporate property interests§How to apply§ § if you are interested to learn more give me a call for a chat, or alternatively click the apply button to submit your CV. jobTitle: Solicitor | Commercial & Private Client Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50568588.txt	§Solicitor | Commercial & Private Client§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor | Commercial & Private Client§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$55k - $85k p.a. + extra benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Absolutely delighted to take an exclusive role to market in Christchurch. There is a bit of clutter in the market currently, but this is one not to be missed. Should go quickly.§About the Firm§Our client is a mid-sized firm with both CDB and suburban presence in Canterbury. It has some properly heavy hitting commercial clients on the books amongst a diverse range of SME and private clients. It’s a nice size whereby you will get some interesting work on your desk, but it is also compact enough for you to make a genuine difference.§This particular team is very social and tight knit, enjoying Friday drinks and other social and sporting events together. Culture wise it is the type of office that will discuss the weekend's sporting results over a cup of tea on Monday morning and find common interests to engage with as a team. There was chat of a table tennis set up, but I cannot actually confirm that! There are also a number of altruistic and charitable initiatives that the team get behind each year.§The partner is known to have brought through a number of top young solicitors and takes a very supportive approach to nurturing talent within the firm.§About this role§We have been instructed directly by a well-regarded partner to source a candidate with genuine client facing potential. The ability to take a client-centric approach and build quality relationships is key. Experience in commercial law, property and private client work e.g. trusts wills and estates will be useful.§A ladder climbing role with the opportunity to work collaboratively with senior members of the team, rather than below them. Whilst it will suit an ambitious candidate with a strong work-ethic, no one in the firm is interested in seeing you slave away for 70 hours per week...§Skills and Experience§Likely 2-5 years relevant practice experience. Alternatively, you may be an engineer with some experience, but have decided engineering is not for you and are looking for a change in career and interested in pursuing IP.§ §You'll join an acclaimed firm awarded 'Specialist IP Firm of the Year' in the New Zealand Law Awards from 2013 to 2017, working alongside people who have received numerous accolades for their work.§ §You'll do interesting work, and learn a great deal as you go, for a wide range of New Zealand and Australian clients across a broad spectrum of technologies and sectors. xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50577759.txt	§Legal Adviser or Associate - Customer Success§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Adviser or Associate - Customer Success§§Advertiser: §ComplyWith NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§About ComplyWith§ §ComplyWith helps businesses and people who want to do things right. People need clarity so that they can do things right.§  §In our mission to create clarity for people we blend our legal expertise and experience with our innovative technology to break down the barriers of complexity and confusion.§  §Our growing legal technology business works with over 130 New Zealand businesses, including many of the regulators.§  §The working environment at ComplyWith encourages creative thinking and suits 'heavy lifters' — those who love to contribute to get stuff done, who embrace challenges, and who are constantly coming up with new ways of doing things better.§  §We value work-life balance. All members of our team have the opportunity to manage client relationships and projects. § §  §What you'll be doing§ §The role is part of our growing Customer Success Team at ComplyWith.  This is the client-facing arm of ComplyWith, and our goal is to drive success and add value for all new and existing customers using ComplyWith.§  §Our work is diverse and covers all stages of the customer journey — from proposals, to implementation, through to ongoing management, we're there every step of the way to support our customers. We also have a big project working with customers to convert them to our New Admin platform which you are likely to be working on in the first year.§  §We are looking for a team member with the skills to comfortably provide a range of advisory services to our legal compliance customers, and who is flexible enough to wear a range of different hats in their role while we're growing our business.§  §While you will work with businesses from a range of sectors, a focus for this role will be our existing and new local government customers.§  §Your primary work will be helping project manage the implementation of new customers and converting existing customers to ComplyWith's New Admin. This work involves mapping our wide breadth of legal content across their business, tailoring a legal compliance survey to the business's activities, and helping organisations to assess legal risk.§  §You will need to drill down into the detail of the customer's business to understand their unique operations, so attention to detail is a must.§  §Once you're up to speed with the legal content and our processes, this role allows for more autonomy and client contact than traditional roles for legally qualified people early in their careers. You will have mentoring and support from senior team members (reviewing your work) and you will be expected to build and maintain strong customer relationships yourself.§  §You will also work closely with ComplyWith's Content Team — our senior experts responsible for drafting and maintaining our legal compliance content. §  §Depending on your areas of interest and strength, you will be encouraged to contribute to the development of the ComplyWith NZ business. The Customer Success team contributes to the software-development roadmap by channeling feedback from customers and your own experience using the tool.§  §What you'll bring§ §Requirements§  §The ideal candidate will demonstrate the following:§ § §2 to 4 years' legal profession experience § §A strong academic record and proven technical legal analysis skills§ §Driven to learn and take on new challenges in a collaborative and practical way§ §An ability to work independently within a close-knit team, and also 'pull together' as a team when the pressure is on§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §A values-driven personality § §Intellectual agility§  §You will need a keen intellect and confident legal analysis skills, which you will deploy in a pragmatic and time-efficient way. You will have an agile mind, with the ability to quickly apply yourself to a diverse range of legal areas whilst moving seamlessly between detailed legal work and 'big-picture' strategic and solution-focused thinking.§  §Excellent communication skills§  §You will need excellent communication skills (and sometimes patience) supported by common sense and the ability to empathise with how non-lawyers see the world and struggle to understand the law's requirements. ComplyWith believes the vast majority of people and businesses want to do the right thing, but they often struggle to get a clear view of what the law requires.§  §Great process management skills§  §We will have multiple projects underway at the same time, and a key challenge you will face is keeping each on track within the timeframes we have promised. You need to be a fan of good process and drive things forward proactively.§  §A values-driven personality§  §We are searching for someone who will be the 'right fit' in our close-knit team.§  §We are building ComplyWith to be a 'most-trusted' brand, with integrity and trust standing at the core of what ComplyWith does. You will have an internal commitment to these principles, and to building our tribe of loyal supporters.§  §ComplyWith employees are 'doers' to the core: they thrive on achieving far more than some might believe possible.§  §Apply§ §Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday, 14 October 2020.§  §If you would like to apply for this role, send your CV, academic transcript and a covering letter to §katemac@complywith.com§  §If you're interested in this role, don't delay in applying. We will be reviewing applications as they come in and, if a suitable candidate applies, we won't wait for the closing date to invite them to meet with us.§  §For more information about ComplyWith, visit our website: www.complywith.com.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§§§

Internally, we have a culture of teamwork which means you will have the security of knowing someone else always has your back. As the largest firm in the region, we provide the full spectrum of services to our clients. § §You are someone with:§ §3+ years of demonstrated post qualification experience in litigation, disputes resolution and employment law (or a mix of them).  Local Government and Court experience would also be very helpful;§ §Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build trust, confidence and maintain excellent relationships with our clients, internal and external;§ §The ability to communicate effectively in both an oral and written capacity;§ §The ability to appear in court and negotiate settlements§ § §§A drive to learn from us and develop your career through our firm; and§ §A readiness to step it up to the next level.§ §About us?§ §Fitzherbert Rowe is the largest law firm in the Manawatu with locations in Palmerston North, Feilding and Waipukurau in the Central Hawke’s Bay providing a diverse range of legal services to our local and national clients in the private, public and charitable sectors.§ §At Fitzherbert Rowe, we create a supportive environment where our people feel valued and their career development is front of mind. We are in growth mode which presents a great opportunity for the right people to go far within the firm and the profession§ §Our team§ §We are a progressive, forward-thinking firm with teams based in Palmerston North, Feilding and Central Hawke’s Bay.§ §Our partners and people have varied backgrounds and expertise that is aligned to our services. This definitely isn't your average litigation role and it will suit someone wanting a commercially driven challenge, with leadership and progression opportunities. A Canterbury network is an advantage but not essential.§ §About the Firm§This firm is led by experienced partners who have developed an excellent company culture. Touring the office, it is easy to see why they have maintained such low staff turnover. Staff are happy, morale is high, and the firm is busy. There are large breakout common areas which speaks to the social nature of the team and partners are proud of the work/life balance maintained by their staff.§The bulk of the work is in property, private client and commercial, which naturally generates a workflow of litigation work. There is an existing team, although it requires leadership and senior level expertise after the seat was vacated earlier in the year.§About the Role§This role has a mentoring and management part to it, as well as a strategic remit, which includes growing the practice, keeping up to date with legal tech and advising partners on growth areas within the litigation practice and for the wider firm.§The work that is generated will be fairly general and diverse, covering things like contractual disputes, debt recovery, insolvency, estates as well as a range of property and commercial disputes.§About You§You will be an experienced litigation lawyer keen on a challenge that sits outside of your typical role. This is an agile and forward-thinking smaller practice which is open to ideas, keen to further embrace legal tech and truly value it's family values culture.§Benefits§Salary is completely negotiable - plus the firm offers a range of extra benefits e.g. carpark, bonuses, health insurance, relocation assistance etc.§Career progression and potential pathway to partnership§A huge amount of autonomy and strategic input. If you'd like to join a practice that does quality work and operates without office politics, then enquire now. § § §Part of this role involves dealing with the changes to the Trusts Act and so having some familarity with these changes is key. § § §To be successful in this role, you will ideally have:§5-6+ years' solid legal experience with a decent amount of trusts and private client experience;§An ability to communicate well and build rapport with a range of private clients from different backgrounds and ages;§Sound drafting skills and the ability to provide advice in a clear and concise manner; and§Some private practice experience is needed. § §This is a unique opportunity to work in a very client facing role in a supportive team - get in touch with us to find out more. § §To discuss further, contact Anand Ranchhod on 027 2746 186 or email your CV and academic transcript to §aranchhod@cobaltrecruitment.com§ or click APPLY now. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our purpose, to build a better working world, has never been more important.
