jobText: TXT/50573013.txt	§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction§§Advertiser: §Bell Gully§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Projects, Real Estate & Construction §      §Our Projects and Real Estate team is looking for a Senior Solicitor or Senior Associate to join our team in Auckland.  The team is recognised as market leading in construction, infrastructure and property development projects across a wide range of sectors.  The team also acts on large-scale commercial real estate transactions.§  § As a senior lawyer, you will be confident advising on construction contracts, infrastructure projects and property development projects across a wide range of industry sectors.  The team prides itself on a non-confrontational approach, with a focus on understanding competing perspectives and context.  This allows us to implement best-for-project solutions which meet our client’s requirements.  You will have experience operating in this way, and your negotiation and drafting skills will facilitate the effective implementation of this approach.§  § The real estate practice involves primarily advising on the acquisition and disposition of commercial assets, as well as leasing and all usual ancillary work. The team has specialist experience advising on the sale and purchase of commercial office buildings, having acted on the two largest commercial office building acquisitions of 2018 and 2019 using a forward-purchase structure.  Your experience will translate, in part or in full, and you may bring something new too.§  § The construction and infrastructure practice comprises a combination of major project work, as well as day-to-day commercial construction contracting.  The nature of this work means we often find ourselves acting as part of multi-disciplinary team together with engineers, financial and commercial advisors and other specialists.  Within this type of environment, you will be accustomed to providing legal advice which takes into account all relevant project considerations.§  § We are looking for an experienced lawyer who has the desire to be involved in market-leading transactions and who has the drive and ambition to do so in an effective and efficient way. § §Experience and qualifications§        §          §5 or more years of relevant post-qualification experience.§          §Big real estate and construction project experience – large construction, infrastructure and property development projects.§          §Strong commercial acumen and negotiating skills.§          §Excellent written skills.§          §Right to work in New Zealand (we will consider foreign qualified lawyers, provided they already have their visa and quarantine arrangements sorted – the firm’s resourcing needs do not qualify for the current visa exemption categories under the covid -19 restrictions)§        § §Culture and benefits§ In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:§        §          §senior associate programme and partner pipeline programmes;§          §community support programmes;§          §a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme; and§          §an annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities.§        § Please apply directly via our website, or contact Tina Ilich by email §tina.ilich@bellgully.com§.  We are not accepting applications via recruitment agents or consultants.§ §We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome. As such, this position is open to anyone with the qualifying skill set. §      §      §      §    §  §§§Our Projects and Real Estate team is looking for a Senior Solicitor or Senior Associate to join our team in Auckland.  The team is recognised as market leading in construction, infrastructure and property development projects across a wide range of sectors.  The team also acts on large-scale commercial real estate transactions.§  § As a senior lawyer, you will be confident advising on construction contracts, infrastructure projects and property development projects across a wide range of industry sectors.  The team prides itself on a non-confrontational approach, with a focus on understanding competing perspectives and context.  This allows us to implement best-for-project solutions which meet our client’s requirements.  You will have experience operating in this way, and your negotiation and drafting skills will facilitate the effective implementation of this approach.§  § The real estate practice involves primarily advising on the acquisition and disposition of commercial assets, as well as leasing and all usual ancillary work. The team has specialist experience advising on the sale and purchase of commercial office buildings, having acted on the two largest commercial office building acquisitions of 2018 and 2019 using a forward-purchase structure.  Your experience will translate, in part or in full, and you may bring something new too.§  § The construction and infrastructure practice comprises a combination of major project work, as well as day-to-day commercial construction contracting.  The nature of this work means we often find ourselves acting as part of multi-disciplinary team together with engineers, financial and commercial advisors and other specialists.  Within this type of environment, you will be accustomed to providing legal advice which takes into account all relevant project considerations.§  § We are looking for an experienced lawyer who has the desire to be involved in market-leading transactions and who has the drive and ambition to do so in an effective and efficient way. § §Experience and qualifications§ § §5 or more years of relevant post-qualification experience.§ §Big real estate and construction project experience – large construction, infrastructure and property development projects.§ §Strong commercial acumen and negotiating skills.§ §Excellent written skills.§ §Right to work in New Zealand (we will consider foreign qualified lawyers, provided they already have their visa and quarantine arrangements sorted – the firm’s resourcing needs do not qualify for the current visa exemption categories under the covid -19 restrictions)§ § §Culture and benefits§ In addition to a strong team culture, we offer a range of benefits and initiatives to help our people maintain a healthy and enjoyable lifestyle. This includes:§ § §senior associate programme and partner pipeline programmes;§ §community support programmes;§ §a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme; and§ §an annual subsidy for health insurance and a range of wellbeing activities.§ § Please apply directly via our website, or contact Tina Ilich by email §tina.ilich@bellgully.com§.  We are not accepting applications via recruitment agents or consultants.§ §We continuously work hard to ensure our workplace is inclusive, and trust that different experiences, perspectives, and values work together to achieve a better outcome. As such, this position is open to anyone with the qualifying skill set. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50547641.txt	§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Banking§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Solicitor / Senior Associate - Banking§§Advertiser: §MinterEllisonRuddWatts§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Banking & Finance Law§§§§§§Looking to advance your career and work with an enviable client list?§Our highly regarded Banking & Financial Services Division is looking for a motivated senior Transactional Banking lawyer to become part of their team in Auckland.§Joining this busy practice, you will be responsible for a challenging and interesting mix of work. The role provides the opportunity to develop your skills and progress your career in a top law firm with an excellent client base, including all the major banks. It is suitable for an intermediate to senior lawyer (4+ years' relevant experience) with a background in general banking and/or insolvency, from another top tier law firm or financial institution. Experience with the Credit Contracts and Consumer Finance Act would be beneficial.§All applicants should have a commercial approach, strong academics and technical skills, together with excellent communication skills that enable you to develop strong relationships. You should also enjoy mentoring junior members of staff and be demonstrating leadership qualities, as well as enjoy participating in business development activities.§About us§MinterEllisonRuddWatts is a top tier New Zealand law firm with a proud year history. Our vision is to be the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people. While we're known as technically excellent, we're also valued advisers that listen and understand our client's business before delivering the best commercial solution.§We celebrate and invest in our team and are committed to helping all of our staff achieve their best. We understand the power that diversity creates, and our collaborative culture and desire to see our people thrive is what sets us apart.§We're proud to be a New Zealand law firm with a global outlook and reach. We have offices in Auckland and Wellington, and connections to an international network through the MinterEllison Legal Group, a leading firm in the Asia-Pacific region.§For more detailed information, please see the link to the position description at the bottom of this page.§About us§MinterEllisonRuddWatts is a top tier New Zealand law firm with a proud 130 year history. Our vision is to be the firm of choice for leading clients and exceptional people. We understand the power that diversity creates, and our collaborative culture and desire to see our people thrive is what sets us apart.§We're proud to be a New Zealand law firm with a global outlook and reach. We have offices in Auckland and Wellington, and connections to an international network through the MinterEllison Legal Group, a leading firm in the Asia-Pacific.§How to Apply§Please click 'Apply Now' on our website to register your profile with us and apply for this job. For further information please contact Kiri Sullivan, Senior HR Advisor on§+64 9 353 9991§ or §kiri.sullivan@minterellison.co.nz§All applications treated in confidence.§§§§

This includes appellate work in the High Court and Court of Appeal.§  §This is a full-time role based in Central Auckland for a lawyer recently admitted to the Bar to three years PQE.§  §Please do not apply if you are not admitted to the Bar.§  §Experience in criminal law is preferred but not essential for this role. The ideal candidate will have a PAL 1 Criminal Legal Aid listing or the ability to gain this in a short space of time.§  §You need to be able to drive to Courts throughout the Auckland region.§  §We are looking for someone with a strong sense of justice who wants to do their part in making a difference. §  §The role involves:§ § §Junioring on jury trials§ §Regular Court appearances§ §Interviewing clients§ §Drafting legal submissions§ §Assisting with administration§ §Full training and support including continuing professional development requirements will be provided. Your practicing certificate will be paid for. §  §The ideal candidate will be highly self-motivated, well organised, conscientious and hard working. The ability to be able to work independently as well as part of a team is important.§  §This is an exciting opportunity to develop your career and learn new skills as a criminal defence lawyer.§  §To apply, please complete the application form, attaching your CV, academic transcript and a cover letter.§  §Applications close 9 October 2020 at 5pm.§  §For further information about Daniel Schellenberg Barrister please visit our website: www.crimelawyer.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in criminal & civil law?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our mission is to open access to space to improve life on Earth. There are endless possibilities for what we can achieve with better access to space, and that access is now a reality thanks to Rocket Lab. Our team is 500 people strong and we’re adding to it every week. Collaboration is at our core - every idea is heard, and everyone makes a difference. Teams are nimble, decisions are made quickly, and we are action-oriented.§    §While other companies talk about it, we do it!§   § §Your mission§ Launch your career with one of the most exciting internship opportunities in New Zealand! jobText: TXT/50694507.txt	§Legal Secretary§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary§§Advertiser: §Bramwell Bate Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Bramwell Bate Lawyers are looking for an experienced legal secretary to join our team of 25 based in Hastings, Hawke’s Bay. This is a great opportunity to be part of a highly regarded law firm with a busy regional practice. We have a diverse client base and act for clients not only in the Bay but throughout NZ and abroad. §  §We are looking for someone who sets high standards for themselves and thrives in a varied role. This full-time role will provide support to three criminal and family lawyers. §  §The right person to join our team will bring with them a background professional services, exceptional administrative skills along with the following:§ § §Positive attitude with a desire to contribute and a team-based approach;§ §Adept at juggling competing demands and priorities;§ §Able to quickly develop a rapport with both colleagues and clients;§ §Experience in preparing court documents, for example, submissions, affidavits, court bundles, applications for bail etc;§ §Competent in Microsoft Office suite with experience in document management systems; and§ §Familiarity with audio transcription.§ §In return, we offer a supportive work environment with the opportunity to develop in the role. Our office is centrally located in Hastings and only 25 minutes from Napier and 5 minutes from Havelock North. Hawke’s Bay has great local restaurants, world-renowned wineries, and an outstanding outdoor lifestyle.§  §If you have the professionalism and skills we are looking for we would love to hear from you. A position description is available on request. Please send your CV and a cover letter explaining why you would be a good fit for the role to Cherie Hannam, Practice Manager, or give Cherie a call if you would like to learn more.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50687555.txt	§Intermediate Lawyer (PAL2)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Lawyer (PAL2)§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.§      §Intermediate Lawyer (PAL2) §      §        §Intermediate Criminal Defence Lawyer §        §Wellington§        § §        § §        §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§        §We are looking for a PAL 2 Intermediate lawyer, with a speciality in criminal advocacy, to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts. §        §You will find challenge and satisfaction with the varied caseload, including high profile cases and the opportunity for High Court and Court of Appeal trials and appearances.  You will have colleagues around you who you can learn from and who will support your development to the next level of your career, and a comprehensive professional development programme. The work comes to the PDS via Legal Aid and you will be supported by professional administrators.  §        §This is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do. §        § §        §Mō te tīma/About our Team§        §You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment.§        §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  In this role you are the voice of some of the most marginalised people in the criminal justice system. §        §Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §        § §        §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§        § To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues and:§        §          §have a PAL 2 approval level and be qualified to practice law in New Zealand§          §have confidence in your ability to develop credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community§          §enjoy sharing legal expertise, exchanging ideas and brainstorming§          §have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people§        §        § §        §Tono mai/How to Apply§        §APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter. §        §Applications close on 25 October 2020 and the salary band for this role is §$79,326 - $102,657§        §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§        § §        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Intermediate Criminal Defence Lawyer §§Wellington§ § §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for a PAL 2 Intermediate lawyer, with a speciality in criminal advocacy, to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts. §You will find challenge and satisfaction with the varied caseload, including high profile cases and the opportunity for High Court and Court of Appeal trials and appearances.  You will have colleagues around you who you can learn from and who will support your development to the next level of your career, and a comprehensive professional development programme. The work comes to the PDS via Legal Aid and you will be supported by professional administrators.  §This is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do. § §Mō te tīma/About our Team§You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment.§The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  In this role you are the voice of some of the most marginalised people in the criminal justice system. §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§ To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues and:§§have a PAL 2 approval level and be qualified to practice law in New Zealand§have confidence in your ability to develop credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community§enjoy sharing legal expertise, exchanging ideas and brainstorming§have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people§§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter. §Applications close on 25 October 2020 and the salary band for this role is §$79,326 - $102,657§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50685776.txt	§Experienced Legal Executive/Property Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Legal Executive/Property Lawyer§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§About us:§ §WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§ §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. The firm was also the winner of the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the 2019 NZ Law Awards (and a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§ §The role:§ §We have an opportunity for a superstar Legal Executive or Property Lawyer to join our Kerikeri team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to really develop your practice, working closely with our valued clients on a broad range of legal work.§ §Some duties of this varied role include:§ § §Managing client relationships (with support) – you’ll become a trusted advisor to your clients§ §Conveyancing – managing the conveyancing process§ §Document preparation – working on a variety of legal documentation for personal and business clients, with supervision and support§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Experience as a qualified Legal Executive or Lawyer§ §Experience running conveyancing and property transactions§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work autonomously but also a team player§ §What you'll get in return:§ §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy flexible working arrangements, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§ §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§ §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your preferred work type?§§§

Special needs of applicants will be considered when arranging interviews.§  §How to Apply§  §To apply, please click "Apply Online."   §  §Applications close 5pm 16th October 2020.    However, we reserve the right to start the interview process prior to the application close date.§  §If you have any questions about this role or would like to see a job description please email:  §Virginia.Ng@nzfilm.co.nz§.§  §Applicants must have the right to live and work in New Zealand.§§§§

You will be managing the workflow of one director, encompassing diary, email, and client management, as well as providing general secretarial support to two other senior practitioners. jobText: TXT/50646041.txt	§Prosecutor 1§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Prosecutor 1§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Police§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Prosecutor 1 §      §        §Police Prosecution Service, it starts with you! §        §          §Nelson§          §Office of Constable/Police Employee§          §Permanent Fulltime§          §Salary range: $77.862,00-by negotiation §        §        § §        §About the role§        §NZ Police are offering an exciting opportunity to join the Police Prosecution Service (PPS) as a Prosecutor within their Nelson PPS team. §        § §        §With PPS you will gain a sound knowledge of prosecution processes including advocacy, knowledge of the Law and court practices. You will be part of a diverse group of Constabulary prosecutors, Police Employee lawyers, and support and managerial staff. Dependent on your level of experience and knowledge at entry you will be involved in various out-of-court case management processes, such as file analysis, writing submissions, and liaising with police investigators and defence counsel.§        § §        §In addition, you will be involved with courtroom advocacy, ranging from first appearance courts through to Judge alone Trials and sentencings hearings.§        § §        §Your knowledge and understanding of key New Zealand statutes and legislation, combined with your desire and motivation to present well-constructed and compelling prosecution cases, will enable you to undertake a vital role in the Criminal Justice Sector and in the operationalisation of New Zealand Police's strategy.§        § §        §Key Accountabilities:§        §          §Communication - Having the skills to effectively communicate with our people, partners and community. §          §Decision Making - Having the critical thinking and problem solving skills to make sound decisions and responses under pressure in a face to face setting§          §Law and Policy - Having a sound understanding of prosecution and court processes, and the ability to analyze complex information accurately. §          §Individually Responsible and Accountable - Being accountable for your performance and taking responsibility for your contribution and development. §          §Clear - Show an understanding of a Prosecutor's purpose within Police and the outcomes we are striving to deliver. §          §Enabling through self-leadership - Ability to seek opportunities to develop your own skills, knowledge and experience §        §        § §        §What you’ll bring§        §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.§        § §        §Special Requirements:§        §          §To apply for this role you must be a NZ or Australian Citizen or NZ permanent resident§          §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a full reference and security check prior to any offer of employment being made §          §Successful applicant must reside in the Nelson area. §          §If you are a Police Employee applicant, you must have an LLB degree and have the ability to get a practicing certificate and provide copy of qualification eligibility.§          §If you are a Constabulary applicant, you must have a current Sergeants CPK and have applied to enter the Sergeants Career Progression Framework, or be a substantive Sergeant, or be fully qualified under a previous promotion scheme. You will also hold currency in PITT, PCT and First Aid certificates.§        §        § §        §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§        §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. §        § §        §For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. §        § §        §These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. §        § §        §For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§        § §        §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser: §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/09-2020/prosecutor.pdf§        § §        §About us§        §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. §        § §        §Working Flexibly§        §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. §        § §        §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        §How to apply§        § §        §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken. For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        § §        §If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact §Lauren.Gennills@police.govt.nz§        § §        §Applications close 5pm, Friday 2nd October 2020§        § §        § §  §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Police Prosecution Service, it starts with you! § §Nelson§ §Office of Constable/Police Employee§ §Permanent Fulltime§ §Salary range: $77.862,00-by negotiation § § § §About the role§ §NZ Police are offering an exciting opportunity to join the Police Prosecution Service (PPS) as a Prosecutor within their Nelson PPS team. § § § §With PPS you will gain a sound knowledge of prosecution processes including advocacy, knowledge of the Law and court practices. You will be part of a diverse group of Constabulary prosecutors, Police Employee lawyers, and support and managerial staff. Dependent on your level of experience and knowledge at entry you will be involved in various out-of-court case management processes, such as file analysis, writing submissions, and liaising with police investigators and defence counsel.§ § § §In addition, you will be involved with courtroom advocacy, ranging from first appearance courts through to Judge alone Trials and sentencings hearings.§ § § §Your knowledge and understanding of key New Zealand statutes and legislation, combined with your desire and motivation to present well-constructed and compelling prosecution cases, will enable you to undertake a vital role in the Criminal Justice Sector and in the operationalisation of New Zealand Police's strategy.§ § § §Key Accountabilities:§ §Communication - Having the skills to effectively communicate with our people, partners and community. § §Decision Making - Having the critical thinking and problem solving skills to make sound decisions and responses under pressure in a face to face setting§ §Law and Policy - Having a sound understanding of prosecution and court processes, and the ability to analyze complex information accurately. § §Individually Responsible and Accountable - Being accountable for your performance and taking responsibility for your contribution and development. § §Clear - Show an understanding of a Prosecutor's purpose within Police and the outcomes we are striving to deliver. § §Enabling through self-leadership - Ability to seek opportunities to develop your own skills, knowledge and experience § § § §What you’ll bring§ §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others.§ § § §Special Requirements:§ §To apply for this role you must be a NZ or Australian Citizen or NZ permanent resident§ §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a full reference and security check prior to any offer of employment being made § §Successful applicant must reside in the Nelson area. § §If you are a Police Employee applicant, you must have an LLB degree and have the ability to get a practicing certificate and provide copy of qualification eligibility.§ §If you are a Constabulary applicant, you must have a current Sergeants CPK and have applied to enter the Sergeants Career Progression Framework, or be a substantive Sergeant, or be fully qualified under a previous promotion scheme. You will also hold currency in PITT, PCT and First Aid certificates.§ § § §This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§ §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. § § § §For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. § § § §These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. § § § §For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§ § § §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser: §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/09-2020/prosecutor.pdf§ § § §About us§ §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. § § § §Working Flexibly§ §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. § § § §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§ §How to apply§ § § §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken. For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§ § § §If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact §Lauren.Gennills@police.govt.nz§ § § §Applications close 5pm, Friday 2nd October 2020§ § § § §  §§§§§

With, and as, tangata whenua, we value Te Tiriti o Waitangi, rangatiratanga, manaakitanga, kaitiakitanga, whai mātauranga, whanaungatanga, and akoranga.§      §      §        §Faculty of Law§Pipitea§        §Te Herenga Waka - Victoria University of Wellington is currently recruiting a Pasifika Law Research Fellow to lead an exciting research project to identify the barriers and interventions for supporting Pacific people to succeed in law school and to take up a career in the legal profession.§        §To identify those interventions, the research project seeks to address the following questions:§        §          §What are the barriers and challenges to entering law school, completing law school, entering the law profession, and achieving and leading within the law profession?§          §What interventions would address the barriers and challenges?§          §What interventions have been trialled and what were the outcomes from these interventions? interventions are recommended and how should these be implemented and tested?§        §        §The Pasifika Law Research Fellow will establish a collaborative research hub as the platform to conduct implementing interventions§          §Evaluating interventions, and§          §Fostering Pasifika into the legal profession and legal academia.§        §        §Whilst based within the Law Faculty at jobText: TXT/50582654.txt	§Junior Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Lawyer§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§About us:§  §WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§  §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. WRMK was also recently named a finalist in three categories at the NZ Law Awards, to be announced in November. In 2019, the firm won both the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the  NZ Law Awards (and was a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§  §The role:§  §We’re looking for a motivated junior lawyer to join our team. As part of our Trusts and Asset Planning team, you will have the opportunity to really develop your practice, working closely with our valued clients while being guided and mentored by your Team Leader.§  §Some duties of this varied role include:§ § §Managing client relationships (with support) – you’ll become a trusted advisor to your clients§ §Learning to take a big picture view for your clients, you’ll advise on a range of matters relating to trusts and asset planning, including setting up, reviewing and winding up family trusts, as well as some conveyancing and wills.§ §Document preparation – working on a variety of legal documentation for personal and business clients.§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Bachelor of Laws § §Comfortable with technology and learning new systems§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work as part of a team but also show initiative § §What you'll get in return:§  §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by our staff and external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy our many social events, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§  §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§  §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a lawyer?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

The services provided include matters covering judicial review of government actions, constitutional questions including Treaty of Waitangi issues, the enforcement of criminal law and the protection of revenue. Crown Law also administers the prosecution process in the criminal justice system, in particular, trials on indictment before juries and provides leadership to several Government networks.§        §We are looking to appoint experienced lawyers into the Crown Legal Risk Group. This includes appointments into a new Public Law team with a current focus on COVID-19 and inquiry work. We would like to hear from experienced lawyers who are interested in:§        §          §advice work, litigation, mediation and negotiation for the Crown, working alongside experienced litigators; and§          §joining a diverse team of great people, who are committed to a collegial, supportive and enjoyable environment, and care about the issues they are working on.§        §        §A role in this team offers:§        §          §cutting-edge work spanning a range of areas of law§          §development opportunities for anyone wanting to pursue a litigation career§          §contact with Ministers      §          §autonomy in terms of taking charge of routine files§          §building and maintaining client relationships §          §opportunities to mentor and develop more junior staff §        §        §We would like to talk to people with a range of skill-sets. We are interested in public sector experience, practical problem-solving skills and people skills. We do not require litigation experience.§        §Crown Law embraces diversity and is committed to an inclusive workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and celebrate the collective talent of all employees. We also support different flexible working arrangements to enable us to be at our best. jobTitle: Governance Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679855.txt	§Governance Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Governance Specialist§§Advertiser: §Hunter Campbell Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$100000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Governance Specialist §      §The Company§You will join a forward-thinking and innovative Public Sector organisation committed to improving the lives and communities of Aucklanders. With a passionate and visionary leadership team, you will be working in a solution-focussed driven environment in an organisation that makes a material difference§The opportunity§Working closely with the Board of Directors to ensure clear, accurate and timely provision of information. This includes, but is not limited to, working with Group Managers and their teams to ensure timely and qualitative delivery of information, organising, attending and minuting board meetings, and day to day support to the board of directors.§   § Your other key responsibility will be to design and oversee a programme of work for the implementation of recommendations from the Board, as well as developing a reporting and performance framework for use by internal and external stakeholders, and other strategic projects as they arise.§ §Your responsibilities will be a blend of compliance, Continuous Improvement and project management. Your keen eye for detail and ability to understand complex information will position you to effectively manage compliance and governance. Meanwhile, you will have ample opportunity to showcase your impressive communication, relationship management, organisational and project management skills.§What you need§Some previous experience in governance/law/Board Secretariat is preferred. However, more importantly, are your drive, energy and the following skills and attributes:§        §          §Bachelor of Laws or similar qualification, or relevant vocational training§          §Excellent written and oral communication standards, with a clear understanding of managing sensitive and confidential information§          §Impeccable internal and external customer service with a high standard of service delivery§          §High standard of time management skills and an ability to work under pressure§          §High standard of effective relationship building§        § §What's in it for you§You will be working with the Movers and Shakers of the organisation and be privileged to work at a Strategic level. It goes without saying that this is a pivotal and highly visible role, giving you the opportunity to demonstrate your worth and capability and to build relationships across the organisation. This opportunity represents an exceptional platform for you to launch your career in a number of potential areas.§If this opportunity is of interest, please submit your CV by following the link below. If you’d like to find out more and for a confidential discussion please call §Wayne Fry §on 021 656 502 or email waynef@huntercampbell.co.nz§      §    §    §jobs@huntercampbell.co.nz§  §§§The Company§You will join a forward-thinking and innovative Public Sector organisation committed to improving the lives and communities of Aucklanders. With a passionate and visionary leadership team, you will be working in a solution-focussed driven environment in an organisation that makes a material difference§The opportunity§Working closely with the Board of Directors to ensure clear, accurate and timely provision of information. This includes, but is not limited to, working with Group Managers and their teams to ensure timely and qualitative delivery of information, organising, attending and minuting board meetings, and day to day support to the board of directors.§   § Your other key responsibility will be to design and oversee a programme of work for the implementation of recommendations from the Board, as well as developing a reporting and performance framework for use by internal and external stakeholders, and other strategic projects as they arise.§ §Your responsibilities will be a blend of compliance, Continuous Improvement and project management. Your keen eye for detail and ability to understand complex information will position you to effectively manage compliance and governance. Meanwhile, you will have ample opportunity to showcase your impressive communication, relationship management, organisational and project management skills.§What you need§Some previous experience in governance/law/Board Secretariat is preferred. However, more importantly, are your drive, energy and the following skills and attributes:§ § §Bachelor of Laws or similar qualification, or relevant vocational training§ §Excellent written and oral communication standards, with a clear understanding of managing sensitive and confidential information§ §Impeccable internal and external customer service with a high standard of service delivery§ §High standard of time management skills and an ability to work under pressure§ §High standard of effective relationship building§ § §What's in it for you§You will be working with the Movers and Shakers of the organisation and be privileged to work at a Strategic level. It goes without saying that this is a pivotal and highly visible role, giving you the opportunity to demonstrate your worth and capability and to build relationships across the organisation. This opportunity represents an exceptional platform for you to launch your career in a number of potential areas.§If this opportunity is of interest, please submit your CV by following the link below. If you’d like to find out more and for a confidential discussion please call §Wayne Fry §on 021 656 502 or email waynef@huntercampbell.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50647172.txt	§Legal Secretary§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretary§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.§      §Legal Secretary §      §        §Legal Secretary§        §MANUKAU§        § §        §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§        §We are looking for a Legal Secretary to join our team in our central Auckland office.§        §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  §        §Strong written communication and confident verbal communication skills are critical - both in terms of the work you will do with the lawyers, but also with our clients. The role is busy and your key tasks will include covering reception, opening and closing client files, writing letters, and data entry of file information. §        §As a key team member at the PDS you will have access to a very successful three month induction programme designed specifically for PDS administration staff.§        § §        §Mō te tīma/About our Team§        §We are a collegial and professional office with around 65 legal and support staff. You will be joining an experienced and supportive team who have a genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in an enjoyable, busy and sometimes challenging environment.§        §Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §        § §        §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§        §To be successful in this role you will need to be:§        §          §a self starter with proven initiative and the ability to take control of a busy workload§          §a team player who will support the lawyers in the office§        §        §          §experienced and efficient in a range of administration functions including typing and data entry§        §        §          §keen to learn about the world of criminal defence law§        §        § §        §Tono mai/How to Apply§        §Salary will depend on skills and experience and range commences at $48,853 (85% of band).§        §APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter. Applications close on 12 October. §        §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Legal Secretary§§MANUKAU§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for a Legal Secretary to join our team in our central Auckland office.§The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  §Strong written communication and confident verbal communication skills are critical - both in terms of the work you will do with the lawyers, but also with our clients. The role is busy and your key tasks will include covering reception, opening and closing client files, writing letters, and data entry of file information. §As a key team member at the PDS you will have access to a very successful three month induction programme designed specifically for PDS administration staff.§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team§We are a collegial and professional office with around 65 legal and support staff. You will be joining an experienced and supportive team who have a genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in an enjoyable, busy and sometimes challenging environment.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§To be successful in this role you will need to be:§§a self starter with proven initiative and the ability to take control of a busy workload§a team player who will support the lawyers in the office§§experienced and efficient in a range of administration functions including typing and data entry§§keen to learn about the world of criminal defence law§§ §§Tono mai/How to Apply§§Salary will depend on skills and experience and range commences at $48,853 (85% of band).§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter. Applications close on 12 October. §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50684334.txt	§Principal Solicitor -Public Law§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Solicitor -Public Law§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Housing and Urban Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Principal Solicitor -Public Law §      §        §About us | Mō mātou§        §We think all Kiwis should have somewhere warm and dry to live, and we want our cities to lead the world in living standards.  This is your opportunity to be part of building a brighter future for Aotearoa.§        §The Ministry of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) is here to deliver the Government's programme to address homelessness, increase public and private housing supply, make existing homes warmer and healthier.  We want to make housing more affordable for people to rent and buy and lead quality urban development strategies to create thriving communities.  §        §About the role | Mō te tūnga§        §Reporting to the Chief Legal Advisor the §Principal Solicitor §will help lead the legal work on the Ministry's busy legislation programme, including implementation of new urban development legislation, residential tenancies reforms and new legislation from the incoming government.  You will also provide operational advice and support to the Ministry's business units.§        §This is a thought and team leadership role. Drawing on your expertise you will contribute to the management, strategy and business planning for the legal team. You will play a key role in coaching and mentoring team members to support overall capability development.  You will also maintain oversight of the branch's current work in the area of public law.§        §About you | Mōu§        §          §Principal level legal expertise in New Zealand public law, with a particular emphasis on legislative development§          §Proven ability to provide sound advice across all levels of the organisation§          §Well-developed written and verbal communication ability which will allow you to convey concise messages and ideas or simplify complex issues suitable to the audience§          §Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills§          §Proven ability to coach and mentor others§          §Awareness of, and sensitivity to, the cultural values of different ethnic groups generally, and Tangata Whenua in particular§          §Interest in the political decision-making process, and especially the Parliamentary legislative process.§        §        §This is a unique opportunity to make a genuine difference to the lives of all New Zealanders' and help create the expectations, culture and success for the legal team moving forward.§        §Be part of the journey, help us make Aotearoa a better place to live. Apply now!§        §Note; this is a permanent full time position . However flexible arrangements will also be considered.§        §How to Apply |§ §Me pēhea te tuku tono§        §Please click on the §APPLY§ button below in order to be directed to the application page.  From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. §For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.§        §You must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand.§        §For further inquiries please contact Annie Colebrook at §annie.colebrook@hud.govt.nz§.§        §Applications closes 20 October  2020.§      §    §    §      §      §    §  §§§About us | Mō mātou§We think all Kiwis should have somewhere warm and dry to live, and we want our cities to lead the world in living standards.  This is your opportunity to be part of building a brighter future for Aotearoa.§The Ministry of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) is here to deliver the Government's programme to address homelessness, increase public and private housing supply, make existing homes warmer and healthier.  We want to make housing more affordable for people to rent and buy and lead quality urban development strategies to create thriving communities.  §About the role | Mō te tūnga§Reporting to the Chief Legal Advisor the §Principal Solicitor §will help lead the legal work on the Ministry's busy legislation programme, including implementation of new urban development legislation, residential tenancies reforms and new legislation from the incoming government.  You will also provide operational advice and support to the Ministry's business units.§This is a thought and team leadership role. Drawing on your expertise you will contribute to the management, strategy and business planning for the legal team. You will play a key role in coaching and mentoring team members to support overall capability development.  You will also maintain oversight of the branch's current work in the area of public law.§About you | Mōu§§Principal level legal expertise in New Zealand public law, with a particular emphasis on legislative development§Proven ability to provide sound advice across all levels of the organisation§Well-developed written and verbal communication ability which will allow you to convey concise messages and ideas or simplify complex issues suitable to the audience§Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills§Proven ability to coach and mentor others§Awareness of, and sensitivity to, the cultural values of different ethnic groups generally, and Tangata Whenua in particular§Interest in the political decision-making process, and especially the Parliamentary legislative process.§§This is a unique opportunity to make a genuine difference to the lives of all New Zealanders' and help create the expectations, culture and success for the legal team moving forward.§Be part of the journey, help us make Aotearoa a better place to live. Apply now!§Note; this is a permanent full time position . jobTitle: Junior - Intermediate Property Business & Personal Lawyer Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50645711.txt	§Junior - Intermediate Property Business & Personal Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior - Intermediate Property Business & Personal Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Victoria Fletcher Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Pidgeon Law is a highly regarded boutique law firm specialising in property, unit title and body corporate law, commercial, trust and asset planning law based in Auckland’s CBD. § §Pidgeon Law is led by two female partners.  Joanna Pidgeon is a recognised property law expert - asked to speak at conferences, be an expert witness on property matters in Court and advise other practitioners as well as her clients.  Her commitment to the profession is evidenced by her past presidency of the ADLS and she continues her long-term involvement in both NZLS and ADLS committees.  Outside of the legal industry, she is the Acting Chair of Auckland City Mission.  Her career began in several of New Zealand’s large law firms.  Motivated to offer a more personal, pragmatic and efficient specialist legal service to her clients, she founded Pidgeon Law in 2008.  Since then she has built a team of 9 lawyers, plus law students supporting the administration of the firm in part-time law clerk roles. § §The firm’s other partner, Liza Fry-Irvine, is a body corporate and unit title expert.  She too is frequently asked to speak at seminars and conferences on unit titles and issues facing multi-dwelling sites in New Zealand and Australia, has drafted the model ADLS Body Corporate Rules and is Deputy President of the Strata Community Association (New Zealand Chapter).  She is also committed to the development of the profession by her current involvement in the ADLS.§ § § §Joanna and Liza have an excellent opportunity for a lawyer with 18 months’ - 5 years’ quality legal experience directly relevant to the firm’s practice, to join their team and make their mark as a trusted property, business and personal lawyer.§  § § § §Pidgeon Law’s clients include the full range of people and businesses involved in property from developers, investors, financiers, surveyors and property managers to property owners.  The team’s lawyers advise on all aspects of property including land acquisition, construction contracts, financing including overseas investment, development and subdivision, leasing, property management, unit title, body corporate, incorporated society and cross lease matters.  Acting for this range of clients on this range of work, naturally leads the team to providing business and personal advice from business structuring, business sales and purchases, commercial contract negotiation and drafting, to personal asset structuring and protection, relationship property agreements, and trust formation and ongoing management. § §Joanna and Liza have created an empowering, liberating and flexible-working environment where you can rely on their leadership and mentoring as well as collaboration with their team of excellent lawyers.  You will work with interesting clients on transactional work covering the broadest spectrum of property, commercial and personal work, tailored to your level of experience and intended to quickly accelerate your development. § §With your strong self and work management skills, you will be motivated, organised, efficient and outcome focused.  Your interpersonal skills will enable you to easily inspire confidence and build relationships with clients and team.  Your clients will expect you to be articulate both verbally and in your writing, with the common sense, pragmatism and commercial instincts to help them meet their needs.  Ideally you will have a solid academic record.§ § § §Feel free to enquire confidentially by telephoning Victoria Fletcher on 021 300 982.  Otherwise, for your application to be considered, you must be able to legally work in New Zealand and must submit your academic transcript, along with your cover letter and CV to Victoria via Seek.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Prosecutor 1 Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50601095.txt	§Prosecutor 1§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Prosecutor 1§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Police§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Prosecutor 1 §      §        §Prosecutor 1, it starts with you!§        §New Zealand Police§        §Christchurch§        §12 Months Fixed Term, Full Time§        §Police Employee, Starting Salary: $77,862.00 (Higher salary negotiable)§        §Job Requisition 24022§        § §        §About the role§        §NZ Police are offering an exciting opportunity to join the Police Prosecution Service (PPS) as a Prosecutor on a twelve month fixed term contract within their Christchurch PPS team. §        § §        §With PPS you will gain a sound knowledge of prosecution processes including advocacy, knowledge of the Law and court practices. You will be part of a diverse group of Constabulary prosecutors, Police Employee lawyers, and support and managerial staff. Dependent on your level of experience and knowledge at entry you will be involved in various out-of-court case management processes, such as file analysis, writing submissions, and liaising with police investigators and defence counsel.§        § §        §In addition, you will be involved with courtroom advocacy, ranging from first appearance courts through to Judge alone Trials and sentencings hearings.§        § §        §Your knowledge and understanding of key New Zealand statutes and legislation, combined with your desire and motivation to present well-constructed and compelling prosecution cases, will enable you to undertake a vital role in the Criminal Justice Sector and in the operationalisation of New Zealand Police's strategy.§        § §        §Key Accountabilities:§        §          §Communication - Having the skills to effectively communicate with our people, partners and community§          §Decision Making - Having the critical thinking and problem solving skills to make sound decisions and responses under pressure in a face to face setting§          §Law and Policy - Having a sound understanding of prosecution and court processes, and the ability to analyze complex information accurately§          §Individually Responsible and Accountable - Being accountable for your performance and taking responsibility for your contribution and development §          §Clear - Show an understanding of a Prosecutor's purpose within Police and the outcomes we are striving to deliver§          §Enabling through self-leadership - Ability to seek opportunities to develop your own skills, knowledge and experience §        §        § §        §Special Requirements:§        §          §To apply for this role you must be a NZ or Australian Citizen or NZ permanent resident§          §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a full reference and security check prior to any offer of employment being made §          §Successful applicant must reside in Christchurch §          §If you are a Police Employee applicant, you must have an LLB degree and have the ability to get a practicing certificate and provide copy of qualification eligibility§ §        §        §This role is set at an Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”§        § §        §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf. For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        §If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact §Lauren.Gennills@police.govt.nz§ .§        § §        §Applications close at 5pm on Monday 28th of September 2020§  §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Prosecutor 1, it starts with you!§ §New Zealand Police§ §Christchurch§ §12 Months Fixed Term, Full Time§ §Police Employee, Starting Salary: $77,862.00 (Higher salary negotiable)§ §Job Requisition 24022§ § § §About the role§ §NZ Police are offering an exciting opportunity to join the Police Prosecution Service (PPS) as a Prosecutor on a twelve month fixed term contract within their Christchurch PPS team. § § § §With PPS you will gain a sound knowledge of prosecution processes including advocacy, knowledge of the Law and court practices. You will be part of a diverse group of Constabulary prosecutors, Police Employee lawyers, and support and managerial staff. Dependent on your level of experience and knowledge at entry you will be involved in various out-of-court case management processes, such as file analysis, writing submissions, and liaising with police investigators and defence counsel.§ § § §In addition, you will be involved with courtroom advocacy, ranging from first appearance courts through to Judge alone Trials and sentencings hearings.§ § § §Your knowledge and understanding of key New Zealand statutes and legislation, combined with your desire and motivation to present well-constructed and compelling prosecution cases, will enable you to undertake a vital role in the Criminal Justice Sector and in the operationalisation of New Zealand Police's strategy.§ § § §Key Accountabilities:§ §Communication - Show an understanding of a Prosecutor's purpose within Police and the outcomes we are striving to deliver§ §Enabling through self-leadership - Ability to seek opportunities to develop your own skills, knowledge and experience § § § §Special Requirements:§ §To apply for this role you must be a NZ or Australian Citizen or NZ permanent resident§ §The successful applicant will be required to undergo a full reference and security check prior to any offer of employment being made § §Successful applicant must reside in Christchurch § §If you are a Police Employee applicant, you must have an LLB degree and have the ability to get a practicing certificate and provide copy of qualification eligibility§ § §This role is set at an Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”§ § § §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. jobText: TXT/50693581.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §Bureau Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Senior Legal Counsel §        §          §This Senior Legal Counsel is a key leadership role, responsible as part of the team for ensuring optimum organisational performance and delivery of some exciting service offerings for its members.   Some excellent work has already been done, giving you a brilliant platform to take the organisation on the next step of its journey. §          §Reporting to the CEO, you will work as part of the senior leadership team to lead, plan, direct and co-ordinate the legal, advocacy, membership advisory and risk & compliance functions on behalf of the organisation. You’ll be able to engage external legal counsel for specialist matters when necessary.§          §This is no ordinary in-house legal role!  There is a great deal of variety to keep you interested and challenged. §          §Day to day this includes the usual drafting and reviewing of legal opinions, contracts, risk mitigation and the like. Arguably, the more interesting work will come in the form of preparing and delivering submissions to legal and government bodies in support of industry regulatory change, with submissions to the relevant government ministers and select committees a somewhat common aspect of the role (and with excellent success to date!)§          §You and your team will also provide some advocacy and support for members in the form of advisory services, training, presentations and the like, so your strong interpersonal skills will be well utilised.§          §To be successful in this role you will need:§          §            §Tertiary qualifications in New Zealand Law§            §A specialist understanding of Property Law and solid generalist understanding of Contractual Law and other legislation.§            §Well-developed commercial acumen, great interpersonal skills and the willingness to present to groups including government officials§            §Experience leading a legal function and mentoring others§            §Ideally experience in in-house general counsel roles as part of a senior leadership team§          §          §We are seeking interest from those with at least 8-10+ years general practice experience.  Given the industry sector, property law experience and a strong understanding of the buy/sell relationship is fundamental to your success. §          § In return, you get to work with a great bunch of passionate people, in an organisation that has a very clear strategy and an emphasis on providing product and service innovation. This role could potentially be managed in four days per week if that appeals.§          §Are you ready to make the move to a sector of the market that is still tracking really well post all the challenges that 2020 has thrown up?  Please call Donna Miller | Partner | Bureau | ph 021 680318 or §09 213 0845§ for more information or apply through Seek now.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§This Senior Legal Counsel is a key leadership role, responsible as part of the team for ensuring optimum organisational performance and delivery of some exciting service offerings for its members.   Some excellent work has already been done, giving you a brilliant platform to take the organisation on the next step of its journey. § §Reporting to the CEO, you will work as part of the senior leadership team to lead, plan, direct and co-ordinate the legal, advocacy, membership advisory and risk & compliance functions on behalf of the organisation. You’ll be able to engage external legal counsel for specialist matters when necessary.§ §This is no ordinary in-house legal role!  There is a great deal of variety to keep you interested and challenged. § §Day to day this includes the usual drafting and reviewing of legal opinions, contracts, risk mitigation and the like. Arguably, the more interesting work will come in the form of preparing and delivering submissions to legal and government bodies in support of industry regulatory change, with submissions to the relevant government ministers and select committees a somewhat common aspect of the role (and with excellent success to date!)§ §You and your team will also provide some advocacy and support for members in the form of advisory services, training, presentations and the like, so your strong interpersonal skills will be well utilised.§ §To be successful in this role you will need:§ § §Tertiary qualifications in New Zealand Law§ §A specialist understanding of Property Law and solid generalist understanding of Contractual Law and other legislation.§ §Well-developed commercial acumen, great interpersonal skills and the willingness to present to groups including government officials§ §Experience leading a legal function and mentoring others§ §Ideally experience in in-house general counsel roles as part of a senior leadership team§ §We are seeking interest from those with at least 8-10+ years general practice experience.  Given the industry sector, property law experience and a strong understanding of the buy/sell relationship is fundamental to your success. § § In return, you get to work with a great bunch of passionate people, in an organisation that has a very clear strategy and an emphasis on providing product and service innovation. This role could potentially be managed in four days per week if that appeals.§ §Are you ready to make the move to a sector of the market that is still tracking really well post all the challenges that 2020 has thrown up?  Please call Donna Miller | Partner | Bureau | ph 021 680318 or §09 213 0845§ for more information or apply through Seek now.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a legal counsel?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§§§
