jobText: TXT/50591640.txt	§Junior Lawyer (PAL1)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Lawyer (PAL1)§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§Junior Criminal Defence Lawyer §§Wellington§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§We are looking for a junior lawyer with a speciality in criminal advocacy, holding a duty lawyer listing would be optimal but is not essential, to join the team in our vibrant capital city's central Wellington office - with clients at the Wellington, Porirua and Hutt District Courts as well as the higher courts. You will join a team of around 27 legal and support staff with a range of experience and a genuine interest in sharing knowledge and supporting one-another in a busy and sometimes challenging environment. §You will find challenge and satisfaction with a varied caseload, including trials and appearances. You will have expert and talented colleagues around who will mentor you and support your development to the next level of your career.  The PDS is well known for its comprehensive professional development programme in criminal litigation and is considered an excellent training ground and full of opportunities for a successful legal career.§ §Mō te tīma/About our Team§The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, service and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.  §The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. The ministry provides centralised business services, infrastructure and support to the work of the PDS.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§To be successful you must be passionate about criminal justice issues and be qualified to practice law in New Zealand.  You will be developing an ability to build credibility with judges, peers and others in the legal community. As an important member of a close-knit team you will enjoy exchanging ideas and brainstorming - and providing support and light relief when required. §You will have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people.  This is a challenging but truly satisfying job and our lawyers love what they do.  § §Tono mai/How to Apply§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV, cover letter and a copy of your academic record. §Applications close on 11 October 2020 and the salary range for this role is §$60,092 - $70,6998§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

the Cooney Lees Morgan Matamata office is expanding so we are looking for a superstar to fill this newly created role.  It’s an important role as you’ll not only be the face of our Matamata office and provide legal assistant support to the team but will also be responsible for making the office run like a well-oiled machine.  We love being part of the Matamata community, so you’ll also be someone who wants to help us grow the business and relationships with new and existing clients. §  §This is a part-time role from 9-3pm five days a week with flexibility needed to go ‘the extra mile’ if required.§  §To hit the ground running you must have the following skills and experience:§ § §Excellent customer service skills§ §Administration experience§ §A minimum of two years legal secretarial experience in property/conveyancing is preferable§ §Confident LINZ and Companies Office user§ §Word and Outlook experience§ §Touch typist§ §Attention to detail§ §Extremely well organised§ §Excellent communicator§ §Good at prioritising§ §Work well under pressure§ §Willingness to learn§ §Enjoy working as part of a team§ §Confident working for several different authors and juggling their individual needs§ §Knowledge of Winscribe Digital Dictation and Infinity Law Trust Account Software would be advantageous.§ §In return we offer:§ § §A friendly and inclusive work environment§ §Modern technology§ §Excellent in-house training§ §Career development opportunities§ §If you are looking for an opportunity to develop your career at a long standing, well respected law firm that values its staff we want to hear from you.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a legal assistant?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobTitle: Commercial / Property Lawyer Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50692512.txt	§Commercial / Property Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial / Property Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Baker Tilly Staples Rodway HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Are you keen to work for a law firm that offers opportunities for career advancement and learn alongside accomplished business professionals?§ §Our client, Nicholsons Lawyers, is the oldest law firm in Taranaki servicing third generation families and offering a wide range of legal services all carried out with a high level of expertise. With such a long history and unsurpassed local knowledge, it’s fair to say they love the province and its people. Their success is atttributed to the strong core firm value that their people are the most valuable asset. It’s this philosophy that ensures that the whole team work hard to grow and maintain strong relationships with their clients.§ §Is this the opportunity you have been looking for?§ This position is incredibly diverse and interesting. You will be working alongside one of the partners across all aspects of property law managing a residential/commercial/property caseload for individuals and small to medium businesses, advising clients on a wide range of transactions. You will be mentored and trained in trust work involving family, trading and incorporated societies and trusts. In addition to this, you may be actively involved in marketing to clients and prospective clients, undertaking project work, and helping to develop new firm initiatives over time. § §To be seriously considered for this role, you will have:§§A Bachelor of Law and current Practising Certificate from the NZLS with up to date knowledge of NZ law and legislation§3 plus years’ experience as a Property/Commercial/Trust Lawyer§An ability to combine logical, analytical and a great deal of creative thinking skills to problem solving§An attitude of getting things done and recognising that client’s time and money matter§The ability to see the ‘big picture’, consider all implications and give practical common-sense advice that works for all circumstances§To demonstrate that you can work quickly and efficiently without compromising quality§A team philosophy that working together accomplishes so much§The skills to communicate in both written and oral with ease and a natural style§If working in an environment where delivering outstanding service is born from a culture that fosters a ‘one team’ approach appeals, then we would like to hear from you.§ §To obtain a copy of the position description email §hr@bakertillysr.nz§. To speak to the Baker Tilly Staples Rodway Recruitment Team about this role, call us on §06 757 3155§ for a confidential discussion. All applications will need to be submitted online with a copy of your CV and cover letter.§ § §Applications close 4 November 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50573304.txt	§Newly Qualified Litigation Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Newly Qualified Litigation Lawyer§§Advertiser: §C & F Legal Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§We are looking to fill a position for a recently qualified law graduate to join our very busy litigation team.  Ideal applicants will be graduates who have completed the pre-requisites for admission and who are prepared to make a long term commitment to settling in one of the most attractive regions in New Zealand.  This position will be very rewarding for an ambitious, hardworking graduate who has the drive, enthusiasm and ability to achieve the best results for our clients and who is looking for a long term position with prospects of equity participation.§ §This practitioner will need a sound academic record, be well presented, and willing to work as part of a team.§ §We have:§ § §An interesting and varied range of work generated from a significant client base spread throughout New Zealand and overseas.§ §Up-to-date IT and legal database facilities, in pleasant, spacious, modern offices.§ §A team of hardworking lawyers as well as a competent and brilliant team of support professionals.§ §A very competitive salary package on offer that will reflect ability, commitment and fee results.§ §A progression programme for all our team that the successful applicant will participate in.§ §Applications, with CVs, including references and academic transcripts should be provided to:§ §C & F Legal Ltd (Attention: Andrew Shaw)§Solicitors§PO Box 1049, Nelson 7040§211 Bridge Street, Nelson 7010§ §Email:   §diana@cflegal.co.nz§Ph:       03 545 8080§Fax:      03 545 8082§www.cflegal.co.nz§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50625321.txt	§20/379 Solicitor / Senior Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§20/379 Solicitor / Senior Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Department of Internal Affairs§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§Type:§ 2 x Permanent & 1 x Fixed Term - 12 months§Hours:§ Full time or Part time §Location:§ Wellington§Business Group§: Legal Services§Branch:§ Organisational Strategy and Performance§Salary:§ Solicitor $66,312 - $89,715 Senior Solicitor $92,316 - $124,897§§If you thrive on cutting-edge projects, like a challenge and to know what you do, you do for the good of New Zealand, this is the opportunity is for you. §§Te Tari Taiwhenua - DIA Legal Services Team recently reconfigured into two teams, to enable us to maximise our value, which comes from our privileged position as trusted advisors and the perspective that gives us. §To help us deliver on our commitment to support DIA to achieve its strategic outcomes, we’re now looking to fill three Senior Solicitor/Solicitor positions in our new Commercial & Corporate Law team – two are Permanent roles and one is a 12 months fixed term contract (parental leave) position starting around mid-January 2021. § §Working in the CCL team will particularly appeal to lawyers who have a strong interest in, and the skill and experience to provide, high quality strategic legal advice on commercial and technology related legal work across DIA’s diverse and innovative operations, including:§commercial and contract law advice, contract review, drafting and negotiation§working on complex projects, procurement processes and cross-government initiatives§property/construction  §ICT/technology and intellectual property§general corporate law issues.§§We’re happy to receive applications for these roles if you’re looking for full-time, part-time, secondment or other flexible working arrangements.§You’ll be working in a collegial environment where experience and knowledge is shared and support, peer review and constructive feedback are encouraged. §There is more information about this role, and what we’re looking for from you, in the Job Description. More information about DIA, and what the Department does, can be found at www.dia.govt.nz§Better New Zealand§§Working at the Department of Internal Affairs, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of New Zealanders. §Organisational Strategy and Performance (Te Urungi)§§We’re a small branch with a big job. We provide direction, oversight and leadership across the Department around risk assurance, project governance, legal services and strategic planning.  §§Role Information§See Job Description. §If you want a job where the work you do matters to New Zealand, we would like to hear from you.§We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.§§Please indicate whether you are applying for the Solicitor or Senior Solicitor role in your application.§§To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:§§People can easily access the services and information they need §Iwi, hapū and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving §People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand §New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local government§§Applications close:§ 5pm, Sunday 11 October 2020§For more information please contact:§ Tim Whiteley at §tim.whiteley@dia.govt.nz§Job description:§ To review the full job description, please click here for Solicitor and click here for Senior Solicitor. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50709182.txt	§eDiscovery Manager§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§eDiscovery Manager§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§A subsidiary of KPMG New Zealand, Streamlined Litigation Support Ltd (SLS) is New Zealand’s leading litigation support bureau. We provide the processing of electronic documents, data entry and scanning of discovery documents for law firms, barristers, government agencies and organisations in a litigation support capacity.§  §The role:§ § §SLS are seeking an eDiscovery Manager to join their team either in Auckland or Wellington.§ §The eDiscovery Manager is responsible for the provision of a number of responsibilities including hosting, eDiscovery support, electronic document processing and IT administration as set out below. This role has one direct report.§ §Day to day you will:§ § §Manage SLS’s hosted document review environment, EDT (hosted SQL database with HTML5/Java front end)§ §Manage system and software upgrades§ §Coordinating eDiscovery strategies with clients and internal/external resources§ §Coach and mentor the eDiscovery Technician§ §Liaise with vendors and related service providers, and maintain a close working relationship§ §Working with the tech team researching additional technology solutions and platforms§ §Loading and processing client data§ §Troubleshooting client queries§ §Exporting data for clients§ §Providing online and onsite training to clients§ §To be successful in this role you'll have:§ § §A forensics, eDiscovery or litigation background is preferred§ §Competent user of MS Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint§ §Experience as SQL database administrator§ §Experience with management and operation of hosted software platforms§ §Experience with management of small technical teams§ §Familiarity with personal computer and server hardware, operating systems and software§ §Prioritising and managing workflows to meet deadlines§ §An excellent eye for detail and ability to quickly analyse information§ §Ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of audiences inside and outside of the company and present ideas in an articulate and clear manner§ §Strong organisational and communication skills§§§§

jobText: TXT/50580547.txt	§Graduate Solicitor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate Solicitor§§Advertiser: §Senthil and Mukusha Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Salary§§$40,000 - $59,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§Graduate Solicitor§ §About The Role: §We are looking to fill a position for a recently qualified law graduate to join our very busy team in West Auckland.  Ideal applicants will be graduates who have completed the pre-requisites for admission. This position will be very rewarding for an ambitious, hardworking graduate who has the drive, enthusiasm and ability to achieve the best results for our clients and who is looking for a long term position.§To Be Successful In This Role You Will Need:§Attention to detail§The ability to work as part of a team and take instructions§To constantly challenge your understanding and focus on successful outcomes§The ability to work well under pressure§Excellent written and oral communication skills§ §This is an excellent opportunity for you to get your foot in the door. We work in a fast-paced environment and are looking for a self-starter. Prior work experience in the legal industry is not mandatory, but will be considered an advantage. Since most of our clients belong to the Indian community, we would prefer the candidate to be proficient in Hindi.§ §Working For Us You Will:§Grow your career as you are exposed to a variety of legal challenges§Be recognised for your initiative and drive§Receive excellent training and support§Have a competitive salary package based on your skills and experience§ §How To Apply:§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV, academic transcripts and cover letter.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50696491.txt	§Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Criminal & Civil Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §    §      §The Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping people access justice, the PDS promotes the values of respect, integrity, and the delivery of excellent service to its clients.§      §Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor §      §        §PDS Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor§        §Northern Region§        § §        §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§        §The PDS is looking for an outstanding senior lawyer to step into this new and exciting Senior role. You will have specialist expertise and experience in criminal advocacy a genuine interest in coaching and mentoring and the ability  to  assist  with  the management  of  the  PDS  duty  lawyer  service. Reporting to the Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor you will support them in the achievement of PDS' operational and strategic goals.§        §The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. There is flexibility as to where this position is based but must be based at one of the PDS's Northern branches in metropolitan Auckland, §Hamilton or Tauranga.§        §This is a senior position with a wide range of interesting and challenging opportunities to influence and shape an essential Court based service. If you thrive in a challenging environment, are passionate about criminal justice and delivering the best outcomes for our clients would like to make a positive contribution to the development of PDS and private bar criminal lawyers, and value the kind of support and collegiality which can only be offered by New Zealand's largest criminal law practice this could be the role for you! §        § §        §Mō te tīma/About our Team§        §The  Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping all people of New Zealand access justice,  the  PDS  promotes  the  values  of  respect,  integrity,  service  and  the  delivery  of  excellent  service  to  its clients. PDS lawyers are the voice of some of the most marginalised people in the criminal justice system§. §        §Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated§ §        § §        §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§        §To be successful in this role you need to be qualified to practise law in New Zealand have current duty lawyer approval, have specialist expertise and experience in criminal advocacy. Have confidence in your ability to inspire, support and empower possess excellent relationship management skills and proven credibility with Judges peers and others in the legal community, have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people have flexibility to travel In return, the PDS offers access to a well designed and embedded national training programme, professional development opportunities and access to a professional supervision programme.§        § §        § §        §Tono mai/How to Apply§        §APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter.§        §Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020 and the salary range for the role is §$130,996 - $169,524§§        §If you have any questions, please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§PDS Deputy Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor§§Northern Region§ §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§The PDS is looking for an outstanding senior lawyer to step into this new and exciting Senior role. You will have specialist expertise and experience in criminal advocacy a genuine interest in coaching and mentoring and the ability  to  assist  with  the management  of  the  PDS  duty  lawyer  service. Reporting to the Senior Duty Lawyer Supervisor you will support them in the achievement of PDS' operational and strategic goals.§The PDS is part of the Ministry of Justice and the wider justice sector. There is flexibility as to where this position is based but must be based at one of the PDS's Northern branches in metropolitan Auckland, §Hamilton or Tauranga.§This is a senior position with a wide range of interesting and challenging opportunities to influence and shape an essential Court based service. If you thrive in a challenging environment, are passionate about criminal justice and delivering the best outcomes for our clients would like to make a positive contribution to the development of PDS and private bar criminal lawyers, and value the kind of support and collegiality which can only be offered by New Zealand's largest criminal law practice this could be the role for you! § §Mō te tīma/About our Team§The  Public Defence Service (PDS) is New Zealand's largest criminal law practice, providing high quality legal advice and representation in a full range of criminal cases. Aimed at helping all people of New Zealand access justice,  the  PDS  promotes  the  values  of  respect,  integrity,  service  and  the  delivery  of  excellent  service  to  its clients. PDS lawyers are the voice of some of the most marginalised people in the criminal justice system§. §§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated§ § §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§To be successful in this role you need to be qualified to practise law in New Zealand have current duty lawyer approval, have specialist expertise and experience in criminal advocacy. Have confidence in your ability to inspire, support and empower possess excellent relationship management skills and proven credibility with Judges peers and others in the legal community, have empathy and the ability to relate to a wide range of people have flexibility to travel In return, the PDS offers access to a well designed and embedded national training programme, professional development opportunities and access to a professional supervision programme.§ § §Tono mai/How to Apply§APPLY and complete the application form, attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close on Sunday 18 October 2020 and the salary range for the role is §$130,996 - $169,524§§If you have any questions, please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50641558.txt	§Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §Airways NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§About us:§ §Airway NZ manage New Zealand's 30 million square kms of airspace, providing air traffic control, surveillance, communication, flight inspection, mapping and airspace design services. The Legal team partners with the business units within Airways to drive the company's strategy and manage its risk. As a state-owned enterprise, Airways operates within a public sector framework, as well as the highly regulated Aviation sector.  The legal function is key to delivering Airway's strategy of safe skies today and tomorrow within this complex setting. § § § §About the role: § §In this role you will work directly with stakeholders across the business providing advice, contract support and training. You will work collaboratively with colleagues in the legal team, and be key in driving the legal team strategy to deliver its objectives.  You will have the opportunity to work independently, but also to benefit from the support and experience of the more senior solicitors in the team.  This is an exciting opportunity to develop your generalist knowledge through exposure to a broad range of in-house, corporate legal challenges.  § § § §To be successful in this role:§ §You will have a Bachelor of Laws, with admission to the High Court of New Zealand. In addition, you will have a minimum of 1 – 2 years post qualified experience. Ideally you will also have knowledge and experience in contracting, legal analysis and advisory work in statutory and/or regulatory frameworks.§ § § §If you require further information about the role, a position description can be obtained by emailing §people.helpdesk@airways.co.nz§.§ § § §If this sounds like the right next step in your career, apply today.§ § § §Applications close 12th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a legal counsel?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§§§

jobTitle: Experienced Legal Executive or Lawyer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50661781.txt	§Experienced Legal Executive or Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experienced Legal Executive or Lawyer§§Advertiser: §WRMK§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - Law Firm§§§§§§About us:§ §WRMK Lawyers is Northland's largest law firm, and provides a full range of legal services. Based in four offices across the North, we are proud of our reputation of being there for our clients whenever they need us. We believe in the importance of communication and being accessible, and have a strong focus on innovation, performance and excellence. We are well-known for our flexible working practices, enabled by our technology and digital office (we were one of the first firms in New Zealand to transition to paperless files back in 2012). Our approach allowed us to keep supporting our clients seamlessly through the COVID-19 lockdown, as all of our staff (not just legal) were able to transition to working from home within 24 hours.§ §In 2020, WRMK Lawyers was the only Northland law firm to earn a spot on NZ Lawyer’s 2020 Employer of Choice and Innovative Firms lists. The firm was also the winner of the Regional/Suburban Law Firm of the Year and Employer of Choice (<50 Lawyers) Awards at the 2019 NZ Law Awards (and a finalist for Mid-Size Firm of the Year).§ §The role:§ §We have an opportunity for a superstar Legal Executive or Lawyer to join our Warkworth team in our brand new modern offices. In this role, you will have the opportunity to really develop your practice, working closely with our valued clients on a broad range of legal work.§ §Some duties of this varied role include:§ § §Managing client relationships (with support) – you’ll become a trusted advisor to your clients§ §Conveyancing – managing the conveyancing process§ §Wills – drafting and executing/witnessing wills§ §Document preparation – working on a variety of legal documentation for personal, business and rural clients, with supervision and support§ §Skills and experience:§ § §Experience as a qualified Legal Executive or Lawyer§ §Experience running conveyancing and property transactions§ §Very strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills and ability to build client relationships§ §Ability to work autonomously but also a team player§ §What you'll get in return:§ §You will be part of a great firm who value our people and are committed to creating a positive and happy work culture. WRMK is consistently recognised by external sources as an Employer of Choice. As one of our team, you’ll enjoy flexible working arrangements, ongoing learning opportunities and career development.§ §So push Apply Now, and move your career forward with us!§ §For any queries, please email §Michelle.North@wrmk.co.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in property law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's your preferred work type?§§§

There will be opportunities to work within the broader dispute resolution team on a variety of other client matters and so experience outside of relationship property in general litigation would be a bonus.§        §While this role would suit a full-time lawyer, we will consider applications from those seeking more flexible working arrangements and have the technology in place to make this feasible. §        §We would love you to start as soon as possible, but we are realistic enough to accept that for the right person we may need to wait a bit.  We offer an attractive salary package commensurate with your experience. §        §Learn more about the firm here. There will be opportunities to work within the broader dispute resolution team on a variety of other client matters and so experience outside of relationship property in general litigation would be a bonus.§ §While this role would suit a full-time lawyer, we will consider applications from those seeking more flexible working arrangements and have the technology in place to make this feasible. § §We would love you to start as soon as possible, but we are realistic enough to accept that for the right person we may need to wait a bit.  We offer an attractive salary package commensurate with your experience. § §Learn more about the firm here. To speak to someone about this role please contact Matthew Jones, our Chief Operating Officer on §+64 3 379 7622§, or by email at §matthew.jones@wynnwilliams.co.nz§.§§§§

jobTitle: Legal Executive Job in Taranaki - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50631577.txt	§Legal Executive§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Executive§§Advertiser: §Baker Tilly Staples Rodway HR§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§Are you an outstanding multiskilled Legal Executive ready to immerse yourself in a law firm that will foster and grow your skills?§Our client, Nicholsons Lawyers, is the oldest law firm in Taranaki servicing third generation families and offering a wide range of legal services. With such a long history and unsurpassed local knowledge, it’s fair to say they love the province and its people. Their success is attributed to the firms strong core value which is “their people are the most valuable asset.” It’s this philosophy that ensures that all the team work hard to build trust and maintain strong relationships with their clients.§Is this the opportunity you have been looking for?§This position is a very satisfying job that will not only allow you to use your breadth of knowledge in your area of expertise as a legal executive but also support you to grow your skills over time into more high profile and complex work. You will be working alongside a Commercial Partner providing essential support in legal tasks across a broad range of matters relating to residential and commercial transactions and trust, estate management. The role will also include an element of client facing work.§The person §§Experience in the areas of conveyancing, subdivisions, refinancing, trusts and estates work§High attention to detail and proven ability to prepare well written legal documentation§Strong initiative with the ability to work independently as well as contributing to the team ethos§Able to manage your time well and balance multiple projects and tasks§Proven experience in establishing and maintaining strong client relationships§An attitude of getting things done and recognising that clients’ time and money matter§Must hold a current NZ legal Executive qualification§In addition to the above criteria your research skills, file management and perceptive abilities are also key to the success of this role.§If working in a strong team environment , focusing on delivering outstanding service to clients matters to you, we would love to hear from you.§To obtain a copy of the §position§ §description§ email §hr@bakertillysr.nz§. For a confidential discussion about this role contact Recruitment Specialist Glenny Lewis on §06 757 3155§. §All applications must be submitted online via Seek §with a copy of your CV and cover letter§Applications close 24 October 2020§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50642025.txt	§Intermediate Solicitor, Enforcement§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Solicitor, Enforcement§§Advertiser: §Financial Markets Authority (FMA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Litigation & Dispute Resolution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Intermediate Solicitor, Enforcement §      §        §Here at the FMA, we are passionate about providing our employees with the opportunity to make an impact in a place where the quality of our work and the measure of our influence is second to none. We are committed to providing a dynamic, well-balanced and inspiring work environment to see you develop and succeed.§        §Right now, we're searching for an exceptional §Intermediate Solicitor§ to join our Enforcement team, within our General Counsel function. Our Enforcement team is responsible for all legal matters pertaining to FMA enforcement action in response to misconduct and contraventions of the law/professional standards within the financial markets.§        §In this role, you will provide high quality legal advice in relation to the FMA's investigation of misconduct and apply your expertise in litigation or regulatory enforcement to ensure the FMA's goals are achieved, and that the enforcement function reinforces the FMA's reputation as an effective, proactive and respected organisation.§        §You will be responsible for taking a leadership role on smaller cases, from the investigation phase through to the conclusion of any enforcement actions, including drafting of instructions and management of external Counsel, the Crown and experts. Advocacy opportunities might arise depending on the case, which could also see you appearing at Financial Advisors Disciplinary Committee hearings.§        §This role is ideally suited to a highly motivated intermediate level solicitor with a background in litigation/regulatory enforcement, however we would consider an experienced financial services lawyer looking to move into litigation. Your tertiary qualification in law, (ideally gained with Honours) and current practising certificate (or entitlement to one) are pre-requisites for the role. A commerce or business degree will be a real asset. You'll have 4-6 years' post admission experience at a private law firm or regulator, where you have gained a working knowledge of civil procedure (essential) and/or criminal procedure (desirable). You will also have strong interpersonal skills, enthusiasm and drive.§        §At the FMA, you'll be proud knowing that the work you do is creating a legacy for New Zealand. We offer flexible working arrangements and a variety of wellness activities. Advocacy opportunities might arise depending on the case, which could also see you appearing at Financial Advisors Disciplinary Committee hearings.§This role is ideally suited to a highly motivated intermediate level solicitor with a background in litigation/regulatory enforcement, however we would consider an experienced financial services lawyer looking to move into litigation. $177,670§§                    §If you thrive on diversity, like a challenge and want to know that what you do makes a difference to the lives of New Zealanders, this is the opportunity is for you.   §Our Legal Services team has recently been reconfigured into two teams to enable us to maximise the value that our in-house legal team brings to Te Tari Taiwhenua – DIA.  That value arises out of the privileged position that we hold as trusted advisors within DIA, the perspective that this gives us and our commitment to making the most of our position and perspective to support DIA to achieve its strategic outcomes.§  §We are looking for a Manager to lead our Policy & Regulatory team in delivering legal advice across a broad range of regulatory systems and practice areas.  The team provides legal advice on legislative design, licensing and other statutory decisions, regulatory investigations, prosecutions and other enforcement action.  This is a new position, responsible for people and practice management for a team of 6 lawyers and part of a leadership team that works collaboratively to provide advice and assurance on legal risk.§  §Reporting to the Chief Legal Advisor, you will be part of the Legal Services team in the Organisational Strategy and Performance (Te Urungi) branch.  You will be working in a collegial environment where experience and knowledge is shared and support, peer review and constructive feedback are encouraged.§  §We are looking for a lawyer with extensive experience in working in government and a good understanding of public law, legislative design and operation of regulatory systems.  You will to demonstrate an ability to lead and mentor a team and to think strategically about the delivery of legal services and management of legal risk.§  §We are an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion. We recognise a diverse workforce contributes to better business outcomes. We are committed to creating a workplace where all employees have equal access.§ §To learn more about the diverse, important mahi we do at Te Tari Taiwhenua and see why we're a great place to work, click here.§We work to make New Zealand better for New Zealanders through our four outcome areas:§§People can easily access the services and information they need §Iwi, hapū and communities across New Zealand are safe, resilient and thriving §People's sense of belonging and collective memory builds an inclusive New Zealand §New Zealand is a well-functioning democracy across central and local government§§Applications close:§ 5pm, Monday 19 October 2020§For more information please contact:§ Andrea Speir at §andrea.speir@dia.govt.nz§Job description:§ To review the full job description, please click here. If you are unable to follow the link, please review the full job description on our careers website. §§§§§

§Corporate and Commercial Solicitor§ §Due to our continued growth Young Hunter Lawyers is looking to hire a junior-mid level commercial solicitor, preferably with 0-4 years PQE. § §Your role will be varied, giving you a wealth of exposure to clients and transactions.    § §You will be the solicitor working in a high performing team supporting a partner, three consultants, two associates and a team of legal executives.  § §Your growth and development will be fully supported by a firm with a culture of integrity, courage, innovation, excellence, and building relationships. § §Role overview§ (drafting wills / contracting out agreements / enduring powers of attorney)§ §Trusts (new trust formations / variations / restructuring / wind ups and distributions).§ §Commercial leasing (drafting jobTitle: Legal Counsel Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50617437.txt	§Legal Counsel§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Counsel§§Advertiser: §Chubb Insurance New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§Are you currently working in a top tier or reputable law firm and seeking an in-house commercial role that will provide variety and exposure to a range of legal and regulatory matters?  This opportunity will see you working collaboratively with the business from day one in order to drive change and deliver pragmatic solutions.§ §Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, with over 30,000 employees globally.  The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally.§ §In New Zealand, Chubb continues to grow and evolve in an environment of regulatory change.  We are at the exciting stage of building a legal and compliance team that is at the forefront of driving change.  You will have a unique opportunity to work across all areas of the business, working with various stakeholders to mitigate risk and provide optimum customer solutions.§ §MAIN PURPOSE§ §This newly-created role will report to the Head of Legal and Regulatory NZ and is a key hire for the business.  You will provide legal oversight across all business lines, manage contractual agreements and respond to regulatory change.  This is an exciting opportunity in a fast-paced environment where you will have the ability to influence business decisions and provide input into the Company’s strategy and direction.§ §THE OPPORTUNITY§ §This position sits within the Chubb NZ legal and compliance team and could see you:§ § §Working with stakeholders across the business to review, negotiate and draft documents including contractual agreements and insurance policy documents relevant to the Company’s operations (such as distribution, broker, procurement, service and confidentiality agreements).§ §Analysing and providing legal and regulatory advice in connection with all aspects of the Company’s operations including business initiatives and transactions relating to insurance products, distribution methods and corporate agency arrangements, customer interface issues such as claims, complaints and disputes and internal advice to the company’s financial, actuarial, audit, human resources and risk departments.§ §Monitoring changes and developments in the legal and regulatory landscape impacting Chubb and assisting in the development of appropriate strategies to meet these developments, including appropriate communications and training for the business and liaising with industry and regulatory bodies.§ §Driving and/or managing projects within the business to respond to and implement regulatory and contractual change.§ §Assisting in the development and awareness of legal and compliance policies at a local level, including privacy related policy documentation and procedures, ensuring alignment with regional and global legal and compliance policies where applicable.§ §Assisting in the development and maintenance of legal templates/precedent documents, legal policies and procedures.§ §Assisting in the selection, retainer and effective management of external counsel.§ §Assisting with company secretarial tasks including drafting Board and Committee reports and documents.§ §Working on other legal, regulatory and compliance matters as they arise from time to time.§ §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §Solid legal experience in a leading law firm and/or in-house environment.  Exposure to the financial services industry and knowledge of relevant laws would be beneficial.§ §A willingness to learn, a positive attitude and high integrity. § §Strong oral and written communication, analytical, presentation and influencing skills.§ §Ability to take initiative, manage competing priorities and adhere to deadlines.§ §In return, we offer you the opportunity to work as part of a dynamic and agile environment, with a competitive benefits package, where continuous development is encouraged throughout your career (both professionally and academically).§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in law?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50692939.txt	§Employment Lawyer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Employment Lawyer§§Advertiser: §Fluid Legal§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§negotiable on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§The role:§My client is a commercially focused firm with a diverse range of SME's, start ups and corporates on the books. The partnership insists on providing a pragmatic client partnership model which is well differentiated in the Christchurch market. It is mid sized with a partnership covering more or less a full suite of disciplines. One of the key strengths is the integrity and poularity of its brand, well known both in Christchurch and the surrounding regions.§There is a requirement for someone with some high level employment experience to work alongside the entire partnership to provide specialist consultation to a range of clients. Current circumstances have created a lot of employment related work for all businesses which is forecast to remain bouyant, particularly with an upcoming election and substantial policy changes on the cards. Hence you will add significant value to the firm, which will be duly rewarded in the form of progression, opportunity, exposure and remuneration.§Make no mistake this is a pathway role and the ideal outcome is that you are someone wanting to build on a strong technical base to really take the next career step.§What you will bring:§Client facing skills and personability are a must have§Experience in complex employment matters, including litigation and alternative dispute resolution§A pragmatic approach and sharp commercial acumen§An ambitious, social team orientated outlook will be a good fit§Other skills outside of employment will also be useful - show me what you've done§Benefits:§Top remuneration, comensurate to experience§Genuine pathway opportunities to be discussed§A CV building firm with a great team, superb partners and reputable culture§If the description above piques your interest, please let me know. I will shortlist and present to the client on an ASAP basis.§To register your interest§Either;§Phone 021 044 3607§Use the APPLY button to send through your CV§ §Eden Brown§Manager FLUID LEGAL§021 044 3607§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50621910.txt	§Inspectorate Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Inspectorate Manager§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Law Society§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Other§§§§§§Inspectorate Manager§  §New Zealand Law Society | Te Kāhui Tu§re o Aotearoa, Auckland§  §About the Law Society§The New Zealand Law Society | Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa is the professional body for barristers and solicitors in New Zealand. The Law Society regulates all lawyers practising in New Zealand and is the membership organisation for practising lawyers. With 13 branch offices throughout the country, the Law Society is the Kaitiaki (guardian) of the practise of law in Aotearoa New Zealand and the consumers of legal services.§  §About the role§We are seeking an outstanding candidate to join our Regulatory department, to provide leadership, direction, and support to the Law Society’s Inspectorate team. Based in Wellington, this position will assume responsibility for the programme to inspect law firms’ trust accounts and carry out the functions as set out in the Lawyers and Conveyancers Act.§  §The work is challenging, varied and fast-paced, and requires a high level of judgment and political nous.§  §What’s in it for you?§  §The opportunity to add incremental value to our organisation, to work as part of a competent & collaborative Inspectorate team, and the opportunity to develop your career with a progressive organisation.§  §This position is a permanent, full-time (37.5 hours per week) role. It is important that the Law Society can attract, support, and retain quality staff and one of the ways we can achieve this is by offering employees the flexibility to manage their work/life balance. At the Law Society we offer our staff the flexibility to work both from home and in the office and give staff more freedom to make decisions suited to them.§  §What are we looking for?§ § §Preferably a tertiary qualification in Law or other relevant tertiary qualification§ §Chartered accountancy desirable§ §Previous audit and risk-based experience in a large accounting firm § §Proven experience leading staff § §Professionalism and the ability to quickly establish rapport with stakeholders § §A high standard of written and oral communication skills. Written skills must include the ability to produce concise, structured, and accurate material § §The ability to produce evidence before the Disciplinary Tribunal and the courts § §Ability to work as part of a team or independently in the field § §Good judgement and discretion § §Willingness to travel (drivers license required)§ §A high level of discretion and confidentiality. § § §  §This is an exciting career prospect for a commercially astute, motivated individual who thrives on creating customer value.§  §The Law Society is committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion and is keen to ensure that appointments reflect New Zealand’s multicultural society. Applications from a diverse range of backgrounds are encouraged.§ §  §For a confidential discussion or additional information please contact Stu Woollett, Acting General Manager Professional Standards (Regulatory) (§stu.woollett@lawsociety.org.nz§).§ §  §Please follow this link for a copy of the position description and application form - https://www.lawsociety.org.nz/professional-practice/legal-jobs/inspectorate-manager-auckland/§  § §  §If you would like to apply, please complete the §application form§ (found on link above) and submit this together with your §cover letter§ and §CV§ to §recruitment@lawsociety.org.nz§.§  § §  §Applications close 5pm, 7 October 2020.§  §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

The main area of practice is in property law, focusing on residential conveyancing, trusts and estates administration, relationship property, farming and business law. The firm is now entering a significant growth phase following a restructure after the nationwide lockdown. The main objective of this growth phase is to firmly establish their presence in the local legal market and capitalise on the gaps they have observed. This is an opportunity to get involved early with an already established firm, with an existing client base of several thousand clients.§ § §The Role & the Candidate§ § To meet their growth plans our client requires a legal secretary with drive and ambition. This role will not be your ordinary secretary role as it will be involving secretarial duties as well as executive assistant duties and will suit anyone looking for a new challenge and be part of a strong, positive working environment.§Responsibilities will include:§Filing of deeds and other legal documents§Collecting and delivering mail§Completion of digital dictations, correspondence, and documents§Liaising, when needed, with clients on behalf of solicitors§Maintain and update Principal’s diary and work calendar§Manage Principal’s appointment schedule§Prepare files daily requiring Principal’s attention and appropriate action§Arrange travel bookings if required§The successful candidate will likely:§Be a proactive and motivated person§Have excellent typing skills, with a relatively high WPM score§Have had some legal secretary experience/experience in the property industry§Be considering a change to get into a more fast-paced work life§Be well rounded, outgoing and be able to relate to clients from a wide range of backgrounds§How to apply§ § If this sounds like something you may be interested in learning more about, give me a call for a chat. Alternatively, click the apply button to submit your CV, all enquiries are strictly confidential.§ § §Emeka Ilogu§ § §Consultant - FLUID Legal§ § §03 467 7228§www.fluidrecruitment.co.nz§§§§

You will work mostly in conveyancing, but undertake general work with wills, trusts, estates, commercial work. As we are not a large firm, we are a tight knit group of self starters who show initiative, flexibility, high work ethics and knowledge to guide and assist our clients. The right person needs to have the breadth and depth of  conveyancing and estate experience in New Zealand law firms to be able to run conveyancing matters on their own from day one with minimal supervision; be unflappable under pressure, have an eye for the details, be meticulous with paperwork and organisation, meet deadlines, have some basic accounting skills, love a challenge and be very client and results focused.  This is a "client facing" role, meaning you will have self confidence and up to date knowledge to represent the firm at all times and meet with our clients to put them at ease immediately.  §  §About the Role§  §Your main responsibilities will include:§ § §Working closely with the firm's lawyers and other staff on a variety of matters including conveyancing, estates, commercial and general practice files.§ §Landoline searches & edealings.§ §Preparing documents in Webforms.§ §Preparing all types of legal documents including drafting trusts, wills, EPAs, estate documents and general correspondence including settlement statements and invoices within our trust accounting system.§ §Assisting the AML compliance officer with client due diligence requirements.§ §Assisting with trust accounting entries and client ledgers.§ §Helping with general administration tasks including reception & telephones, photocopying, filing and managing our deeds register.§ §Benefits and Perks§ § §Flexible work hours and a supportive team environment in new and modern offices.§ §Access to ongoing professional development.§ §Free parking.§ §Skills and Experience§ § §minimum of one to three years legal executive experience working in a New Zealand law firm.§ §Be highly motivated, self managing,with an ability to cope with sometimes stressful situations. § §A willingness to learn new things.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§ §Work efficiently and effectively with high levels of accuracy and attention to detail.§ §Have excellent communication and multi-tasking skills.§ §Show initiative, confidence and maturity.§ §A demonstrated ability to juggle priorities as they change throughout the day/week to achieve deadlines and client demands.§ §A willingness to always go the extra mile and be flexible in a demanding environment.§ §Be able to handle people from all walks of life especially in difficult situations.§ §Professional, ethical and courteous on the phone and face to face. § §To apply, please forward a full covering letter outlining why you think you are the right person for us and an up to date CV with verbal references for two people including a current employer.  You can also read more about us at www.ginajansen.co.nz.  §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your jobTitle: Senior Trustee - Highbrook location  Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50666164.txt	§Senior Trustee - Highbrook location §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Trustee - Highbrook location §§Advertiser: §Public Trust§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Law Clerks & Paralegals§§§§§§At Public Trust, caring for people is the lifeblood of our organisation and at the centre of everything we do. Over the last 145 years we've supported thousands of New Zealand families and businesses to look after what is important to them.§We couldn't do this without our awesome customer centre teams, who connect with our customers to understand their needs and provide appropriate solutions. If you are empathetic, can build relationships with a wide range of people and are commercially savvy, then you could be the perfect fit for our well-established Highbrook customer centre team.§With extensive training, support, and opportunities for career progression, why not join us at Public Trust?§About the role§We are seeking a Senior Trustee to join our conveniently located customer centre in Highbrook.§Our Senior Trustees form a key part of our trustee teams, partnering with our Associate and Principal Trustees to provide exceptional service by connecting with our customers to manage their family assets, wills, estates, power of attorney and trusts in order to plan for their future.§In this varied role, you will support the support the Principal Trustee on more complex files, while coaching and mentoring our Associate Trustees on less complex work. You will work with customers face to face and behind the scenes to establish their needs and provide appropriate solutions from Public Trust's products and services.§This is a unique opportunity that requires someone with a high level of empathy, commercial acumen and exceptional interpersonal skills to work with our customers in what can often be a difficult time for them.§Who we're looking for§Specialist knowledge of our industry and products is not required as we provide training, however having a positive attitude, the ability to learn and problem-solve, as well as having integrity and resilience are integral to being successful in this role. We are looking for:§Several years' experience in a role that has involved providing exceptional customer care in emotionally challenging situations§Experience coaching, mentoring and collaborating with a wider team§The ability to self-manage, work flexibly and prioritise work§Impeccable verbal and written communication§The ability to learn new processes and systems quickly§Exposure to basic accounting concepts would be helpful§Experience working in an environment where time is recorded and invoiced for will also be helpful.§In return§Public Trust are taking the lead in educating New Zealanders on the importance of planning for their future. We offer competitive remuneration, career progression, the chance to work with leading professionals in the areas of family asset planning, wills, estates, trusts and investments, an additional day of leave for your birthday and a wide range of discounts on insurance, banking, travel, car hire and more.§As a part of our extensive learning and development, you will have the opportunity to be enrolled in our §Retail Learning Academy§ - a three month programme that will provide you with learning opportunities to develop you into a fully fledged Senior Trustee.§Our flexible working policy and technology gives our people the opportunity to flex their hours and work from home if needed.§About Public Trust§Public Trust is New Zealand's largest trustee services organisation. We are proud of what we have achieved over the last 140 years' and we are passionate about helping thousands of families and businesses look after what is important to them.§By putting our customers at the center of what we do, we help New Zealanders preserve the present and secure their future. We provide specialist advice on a full range of estate planning services including; legal, financial, investment, trusts and estate protection.§We have spent the last few years transforming our business to ensure we have effective tools in place that enable our employees to be a trusted advisors through the lifetime of our customers.§To Apply§If you are interested in this role, apply now via our careers site https://careers.publictrust.co.nz.§For any queries please email us at §recruitment@publictrust.co.nz§ (Please note: applications must be submitted online via our careers site and will not be accepted via email).§Please note: applications will be reviewed as they come in and interviews may commence prior to the close date of Sunday 30th August 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Thanks for stopping by 👋 §  §Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!§  §We are looking for a Senior Legal Counsel to join our team in Newmarket and to support Vend with its rocket-ship growth as it continues its mission as a global SaaS leader transforming the retail ecosystem.§  §Who we are and what we do:§  §Vend is an award-winning SaaS company winning on a global scale. We have over 250 talented people across 5 major markets (US, CA, UK, NZ, AU) working to delight approximately 25,000 awesome retailers worldwide.§  §💚 Our mission: help our retailers build thriving businesses, live more fulfilling lives and create experiences that people love.§  §What you’ll be doing:§ § §Drafting, reviewing, negotiating, and managing a wide range of legal agreements, including technology agreements, partnership agreements, vendor contracts, and customer terms;§ §Keeping across relevant changes to law globally (including data protection, fiscal regulation, open source licensing, and payments);§ §Scoping and leading projects required to implement new legislative developments;§ §Maintaining Vend’s existing global data protection, risk, and compliance programmes;§ §Advising Vend’s international offices on marketing and competition issues, leasing, and assisting with RFPs and enterprise negotiations.§ §And a little bit of.... § § §Continuing to build the legal function at Vend;§ §Implementing new policies, processes, and procedures;§ §Developing and delivering training and education programmes to Venders on relevant areas of law;§ §Providing thought-partnership, as a trusted advisor, to the executive team and other leaders in the business. § §What you need to bring:§ § §Strong commercial/contract experience, from working in private practice and in-house (preferably in a tech/SaaS setting); and§ §Ideally some global experience, particularly across US, UK, Canada, and/or Australia.§ §Why do you want to work at Vend?§ § §You will be offered a competitive salary§ §This role can be full time or part time and we offer flexible working hours§ §We will provide you with opportunities to develop your career§ §You can help build an amazing product in a company big enough for growth but lean enough to make a genuine impact§ §Plus, we have a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy, healthy and (not) hungry:§ § §Secure, full-time carpark§ §Dog-friendly environment§ §Free fresh fruits, snacks and drinks (and cake for your birthday!)§ §Paid leave and assistance for new parents§ §Travel insurance for you and your family§ §Vend Share Options scheme§ §Four weeks annual leave + extra day over the Christmas holidays§ §Where to from here?§  §Obviously, we’re looking to ensure it’s a solid fit from both sides: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world, feel free to check out our Instagram.§  §Vend is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity.§§§§

Our clients range from start-ups and small to medium enterprises, to publicly-listed multinationals, government, and research institutes across 130 countries.§ §Right now, we're on the lookout for patent professionals with a relevant degree and preferably three to eight years' post-qualification work experience, specialising in physics or mechanical, aeronautical or process engineering through to mechatronics, electrical and electronic engineering. Alternatively, you may be an engineer with some experience, but have decided engineering is not for you and are looking for a change in career and interested in pursuing IP.§ §You'll join an acclaimed firm awarded 'Specialist IP Firm of the Year' in the New Zealand Law Awards, and work alongside people who have received numerous accolades for their work.§ §You'll do interesting work, and learn a great deal as you go, for a wide range of New Zealand and Australian clients across a broad spectrum of technologies and sectors. jobText: TXT/50699221.txt	§Corporate Lawyer - 5+ PQE§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Corporate Lawyer - 5+ PQE§§Advertiser: §LegalVision ILP Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Corporate & Commercial Law§§§§§§About LegalVision§ §LegalVision is a market disruptor in the commercial legal services industry. Our innovative business model and custom-built technology allow our lawyers to provide a faster, better quality and more cost-effective client experience. LegalVision is a leader in delivering legal services in Australia and has assisted more than 150,000 businesses. We were recently named an Employer of Choice by Australasian Lawyer, Best NewLaw Firm at the Australian Law Awards in 2019 and fastest growing law firm in APAC by the Financial Times in 2018 and 2020.§ §After experiencing great success in the Australian market, we are excited to broaden our horizons and launch in New Zealand in 2021! If you’re excited to be a part of a growing business that offers challenging work, a start up environment and plenty of work life balance, this might be the perfect opportunity for you!§ §The Opportunity§ §We are looking for an experienced New Zealand qualified Corporate Lawyer to join our highly successful corporate practice. You will partner with New Zealand and Australia’s leading startups and venture capital funds on high value deals to meaningfully impact their growth, while simultaneously guiding that of our New Zealand practice. § §Our Australian startup capital raising team is recognised across the industry as one of the country’s leading practices. We advise on hundreds of transactions each year, ranging from Seed rounds to Series C and beyond. Our clients include early stage startups, later stage startups and a variety of investors, including venture capital funds. We are excited to replicate our success in Australia in the New Zealand startup market.§ §This position is ideal for an experienced (5+ PQE) lawyer with broad expertise in corporate law, ideally within a recognised firm or company. You should have experience in effectively managing matters from end to end in a fast paced environment. You are excited about the prospect of growing a practice from scratch, while having the support of your team members based in Australia.§ §The Ideal Candidate§ §Experienced: At least 5 years PQE in a reputable legal environment specialising in corporate law (demonstrated experience in capital raising and M&A is ideal). Additional experience in general commercial contracts and employment law will be highly regarded.§ §Qualified: Holder of a current practising certificate in New Zealand; willing to become admitted in New South Wales, Australia.§ §Startup savvy: Genuinely interested in NewLaw, startups and innovation; excited to disrupt BigLaw.§ §Commercial: Has business acumen; is practical, pragmatic and cares about growth.§ §Ambitious: Hungry to learn and grow; excited to build a practice and make their mark on the industry.§ §Attentive: Brilliant attention to detail; nothing ever slips through the cracks.§ §Autonomous: Likes help, but doesn’t need too much of it; owns their work and is capable of working independently; loves responsibility and working directly with clients.§ §Adaptable: Grasps new concepts quickly; goes with the flow; improves every day.§ §Efficient: Prioritises effectively; focuses on what matters; delivers on time.§ §The Perks§ §Fully remote working opportunity - work from anywhere in New Zealand or Australia!§ §No billable hours, and no suits!§ §Competitive salary.§ §Fast-paced startup environment with endless growth opportunities.§ §Annual budget to spend on external learning opportunities.§ §How to Apply§ §If this opportunity sounds like your ideal next move, we’d love to hear from you! Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so apply early to avoid missing out.§ §A note to recruiters: we’re all over this role, so there’s no need for you to get in touch. LegalVision does not accept unsolicited CVs or responsibility for any fees related to unsolicited CVs. Thanks!§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50582890.txt	§Solicitor - Immigration/ Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Solicitor - Immigration/ Employment§§Advertiser: §MK Law Barristers and Solicitors§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Industrial Relations & Employment Law§§§§§§About the business§ § § §We are an Auckland central firm of lawyers specialised in immigration and employment law. We take pride in providing professional and value-added legal services to migrant communities in Auckland. Our Google ratings speak for ourselves! § §Coming from a unique background as a former immigration officer, the principal of the firm is specialised in all facets of immigration matters including compliance, deportation and proceedings against INZ. He is regularly invited to speak at professional seminars for immigration practitioners. He is a current member of the Immigration and refugee committee of the Auckland District Law Society of New Zealand.§ § § §About the role§ § § §A rare opportunity has arisen for a junior to an intermediate level lawyer to join our team. § §This role requires a wide range of legal tasks including, but not limited to:§ §advising clients of their legal positions and issues;§communicating with relevant parties on behalf of clients;§preparing and filing legal documents;§attending meetings, mediations and negotiations;§issuing and conducting proceedings at ERA, tribunal and courts.§ § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Flexible working conditions, friendly environment and modern office setting in the heart of the city centre are just addenda to your great potential to develop your career as a specialist immigration and employment lawyer. There is also an opportunity to be exposed to broaden your legal expertise into criminal law as we are stationed together with a reputable criminal lawyer. § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §Ideally, you are a people-oriented person, who will have experienced in conducting cases at INZ, IPT, ERA and/ or a higher court level, but having no relevant experience is not a deal-breaker if you are a fast learner and have the natural people skills and advocating ability. Your ability to speak in one of our clients' main languages is a bonus!§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a solicitor?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you hold a current New Zealand legal practising certificate?§§§
