jobText: TXT/50572685.txt	§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative§§Advertiser: §Land Information New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Property Law§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Consulting Solicitor - Law Society Stakeholder Representative §      §      §      §        §          §Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§          §Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§          §Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§        §        §At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§        §We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§        §To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§        §To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§        §Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §        §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§        §The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§        §This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §        §How to Apply§        §To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§        §Applications close 11th October 2020.§        §If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Do you enjoy an intellectual challenge and complex decision making?§§Looking for fast paced, meaningful work with a high level of public interest?§§Play a key role in modernising Land Titles for NZ§§At Land Information New Zealand (LINZ), our key role is to ensure that we are protecting New Zealand's land and assets. We do this by ensuring that New Zealanders have accurate information about the land and its use, that they have confidence in their property rights and that our land is well-managed and maintained for future generations.§We are focused on establishing ourselves as an organisation that actively influences our sector to provide services that are more modern, efficient, and effective for New Zealand.  To achieve this LINZ wishes to become more proactive both as regulators of land related transactions and as stewards of information about the land.  Our objective is to work with customers and industry participants to ensure the effective use of the information we make available and to co-create new modernised services.§To enable our goal, we are building a bespoke enterprise solution with great challenges, many moving parts, with an energised team driven to deliver world class products.§To help us realise this goal, we are seeking a customer-centric, collaborative, and innovative §Consulting Solicitor§ to join us.§Working as a consulting solicitor for our Survey and Titles Enhancement Programme, this role gives you a fantastic opportunity to contribute to the design and development of a new and enhanced Landonline functionality by acting as the liaison between the programme and the New Zealand Law Society |Te Kāhui Ture o Aotearoa (Law Society).  As part of our proficient and professional team, you'll be provided with a broad variety of challenging work which will include providing strategic advice and sharing your comprehensive knowledge of the property and conveyancing environment. §Ideally, you will have had previous experience in a property and conveyancing environment and will be commercially savvy with exceptional analytical skills. You'll be confident at producing balanced advice and building effective stakeholder relationships and won't hesitate to proactively respond to our daily challenges. You will hold or can hold a current practising certificate from the Law Society, and be a member of its Property Law Section.§The role will give you the chance to work as part of a cohesive, high functioning team and so it is vital that you are knowledgeable and able to relate well to people of all levels and backgrounds. You will serve as an §ex officio §member of the Law Society Property Law Section‘s Land Titles Subcommittee, and have the support of the committee as practitioners dedicated to improving Landonline and conveyancing practices.§This strategic career move will allow you to be involved in challenging and politically visible work that impacts positively on New Zealand's future. §How to Apply§To apply, please click "Apply Online." You'll be taken through to our LINZ Careers Centre where you'll be able to review further information about the responsibilities and accountabilities of this role in the Position Description. You'll be able to complete your online application form and upload a copy of your CV/Cover Letter. Please keep in mind when including your CV to specifically highlight how you demonstrate the capabilities and skills listed in the above ad and the position description.§Applications close 11th October 2020.§If you have any questions about this role or working at LINZ, please email §opportunities@linz.govt.nz§ and our Recruitment Team will be in touch with you.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50709701.txt	§Senior Legal Counsel (fixed term or secondment opportunity to 24 December 2021)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Legal Counsel (fixed term or secondment opportunity to 24 December 2021)§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Customs Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Legal§, §Generalists - In-house§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Legal Counsel (fixed term or secondment opportunity to 24 December 2021) §      §        §Do you want to make a positive difference to the protection of New Zealand's border from serious threats including COVID-19, the facilitation of legitimate trade and travel, and the collection of customs and excise revenue on behalf of the Crown? New Zealand Customs Service (Customs) | Te Mana Ārai o Aotearoa protects New Zealand against threats to the border.§        §We are looking for an experienced senior solicitor to join the Customs Legal team on a fixed term until 24 December 2021. This is a new role which has arisen from the need to support implementation of the Maritime Border Order under the COVID-19 Public Health Response Act 2020.§        §You will work across many exciting legal areas, including law enforcement, COVID-19 response, national security, drugs and other prohibited goods, and tax/revenue collection. The Customs Legal team provides legal advice on policy and legislative development in the border sector, procurement and commercial contracts, OIA and privacy law, information sharing, international arrangements with a focus on trade and travel, litigation and a wide range of operational issues arising under the Customs and Excise Act 2018 and other Acts we enforce at the border.§        §Working as part of a supportive and engaged legal team that is committed to encouraging career development, you will work to achieve excellent results and enjoy using your initiative, judgement and experience. You will provide expert advice on a wide range of legal matters affecting Customs and ensure the delivery of high quality advice and professional service. You will enjoy engaging with the business to deliver results and, where appropriate, mentor less experienced colleagues to support their development in role.§        §To be successful as Senior Legal Counsel you will:§        §          §Be a qualified lawyer with at least 5 years relevant post qualification experience§          §Have experience working in a government or relevant commercial environment§          §Lead the provision of high quality legal advice§          §Achieve results both within a team and independently, showing a high level of initiative and judgement, flexibility and a sense of responsibility§          §Communicate with influence.§        §        §Apply now§        §To join Customs in any role you must be a §New Zealand citizen or NZ permanent resident§*.§        §(*) §A New Zealand Citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident who has resided continuously in New Zealand for the last 5 years and resides in NZ at time of application;§        §OR a New Zealand Citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident who has resided in New Zealand for the last 5 years and resides in NZ at time of application, but may have been absent from New Zealand for periods of six or more months within the past five years, preferably in one or more of the following countries: either Australia, Canada, UK or the USA. You will be required to provide overseas police certificates for these periods spent outside of New Zealand.§        §Applicants must have §New Zealand Citizenship§ or have §NZ Permanent Residency§ and be able to obtain and maintain an organisational security clearance. The successful applicant will also be required to pass an initial drug test. For further information about this role, please contact Suzanne Leahy at §Suzanne.leahy@customs.govt.nz§        §New Zealand Customs Service | Te Mana Ārai o Aotearoa is a member of Diversity Works New Zealand and is committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace. We provide equal employment opportunities, consider flexible working arrangements and welcome applications from everyone who can meet the requirements of the role.§        §Please visit our website http://www.customs.govt.nz.to apply on line submitting a CV and Cover Letter that demonstrates your ability to meet the competencies required for the role as outlined in the position description along with what attracts you to this position and working within the New Zealand Customs Service.§        §Applications close at 11pm, Sunday 25 October 2020.§        §Our Benefits§        §          §Discounted health insurance for permanent staff§          §Learning and development opportunities§          §Free in-house gym access (in some locations)§          §Flexible working arrangements.§        §      §      §Please click the 'Apply Now' button below§      §www.customs.govt.nz§    §    §  §§§Do you want to make a positive difference to the protection of New Zealand's border from serious threats including COVID-19, the facilitation of legitimate trade and travel, and the collection of customs and excise revenue on behalf of the Crown? New Zealand Customs Service (Customs) | Te Mana Ārai o Aotearoa protects New Zealand against threats to the border.§We are looking for an experienced senior solicitor to join the Customs Legal team on a fixed term until 24 December 2021. This is a new role which has arisen from the need to support implementation of the Maritime Border Order under the COVID-19 Public Health Response Act 2020.§You will work across many exciting legal areas, including law enforcement, COVID-19 response, national security, drugs and other prohibited goods, and tax/revenue collection. The Customs Legal team provides legal advice on policy and legislative development in the border sector, procurement and commercial contracts, OIA and privacy law, information sharing, international arrangements with a focus on trade and travel, litigation and a wide range of operational issues arising under the Customs and Excise Act 2018 and other Acts we enforce at the border.§Working as part of a supportive and engaged legal team that is committed to encouraging career development, you will work to achieve excellent results and enjoy using your initiative, judgement and experience. You will provide expert advice on a wide range of legal matters affecting Customs and ensure the delivery of high quality advice and professional service. You will enjoy engaging with the business to deliver results and, where appropriate, mentor less experienced colleagues to support their development in role.§To be successful as Senior Legal Counsel you will:§Be a qualified lawyer with at least 5 years relevant post qualification experience§Have experience working in a government or relevant commercial environment§Lead the provision of high quality legal advice§Achieve results both within a team and independently, showing a high level of initiative and judgement, flexibility and a sense of responsibility§Communicate with influence.§Apply now§To join Customs in any role you must be a §New Zealand citizen or NZ permanent resident§*.§(*) §A New Zealand Citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident who has resided continuously in New Zealand for the last 5 years and resides in NZ at time of application;§OR a New Zealand Citizen or New Zealand Permanent Resident who has resided in New Zealand for the last 5 years and resides in NZ at time of application, but may have been absent from New Zealand for periods of six or more months within the past five years, preferably in one or more of the following countries: either Australia, Canada, UK or the USA. You will be required to provide overseas police certificates for these periods spent outside of New Zealand.§Applicants must have §New Zealand Citizenship§ or have §NZ Permanent Residency§ and be able to obtain and maintain an organisational security clearance. The successful applicant will also be required to pass an initial drug test. For further information about this role, please contact Suzanne Leahy at §Suzanne.leahy@customs.govt.nz§New Zealand Customs Service | Te Mana Ārai o Aotearoa is a member of Diversity Works New Zealand and is committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace. We provide equal employment opportunities, consider flexible working arrangements and welcome applications from everyone who can meet the requirements of the role.§Please visit our website http://www.customs.govt.nz.to apply on line submitting a CV and Cover Letter that demonstrates your ability to meet the competencies required for the role as outlined in the position description along with what attracts you to this position and working within the New Zealand Customs Service.§Applications close at 11pm, Sunday 25 October 2020.§Our Benefits§Discounted health insurance for permanent staff§Learning and development opportunities§Free in-house gym access (in some locations)§Flexible working arrangements.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Legal Secretaries Job in Auckland - SEEK
experience: We're looking for two smart people with a minimum of three - four years
xenophobe: We're looking for two smart people with a minimum of three - four years administrative or secretarial experience to join our Patents teams, assisting senior attorneys. Legal experience is preferable, however, full training will be given to the successful candidate. You must have excellent keyboard and grammar skills and a legal right to work in New Zealand.
jobText: TXT/50709677.txt	§Legal Secretaries§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Legal Secretaries§§Advertiser: §AJ Park§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Legal§, §Legal Secretaries§§§§§§Legal Secretaries§ § §Employer of Choice finalist (NZ Lawyer)§ §Intellectual property law firm § §Auckland CBD§ §Permanent full-time§ §AJ Park is New Zealand's largest intellectual property (IP) law firm. We help companies and individuals identify, develop, protect, commercialise, manage and enforce their IP rights in New Zealand, Australia and throughout the world. Our clients range from entrepreneurs, start-ups and SMEs, to government institutions, multinationals and major listed companies across 130 countries.§ §We're looking for two smart people with a minimum of three - four years administrative or secretarial experience to join our Patents teams, assisting senior attorneys. Legal experience is preferable, however, full training will be given to the successful candidate. You must have excellent keyboard and grammar skills and a legal right to work in New Zealand.§ §The work is varied, interesting and challenging. You will get to expand your knowledge in IP, learn what's happening in the world of technology and innovation, and gain valuable skills.§ §If you take pride in your professional approach to work,enjoy using your initiative, demonstrate excellent organisational skills and have a high attention to detail, this could be your next career move.§ §AJ Park has an enviable reputation in the market and is a great place to work. We have a strong people-focused culture and have recently been named in NZ Lawyer's inaugural Employer of Choice report listing the 25 top-ranking legal organisations in New Zealand in terms of overall employee experience. This report celebrates employers who go beyond industry standards to provide their people with a safe and engaging working environment and showcases firms leading the way with policies and initiatives that engage their staff. We were also a finalist in the 'Employer of Choice' category of the New Zealand Law Awards 2019. We have a comprehensive health and wellbeing programme that includes a wide range of social and health activities.§ §If you would like to work in a supportive and friendly environment, take this opportunity to join our award-winning firm.§ §Please send your CV and covering letter to §careers@ajpark.com§§§§
